loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy caustic soda and oil for soap-making.

loans.name: Shirkhan

texts.en: Shirkhan is 50 years old. He has been married for 24 years and has three children. His elder daughter studies a course at a medical college while his other daughter is in tenth grade. She plays piano well and is preparing for musical college. Shirkhan’s son is preparing for a university education. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from their native land of Fuzuli and now live in the Baku region. Shirkhan has been selling building materials for 12 years. Today Shirkhan needs a loan to buy more types of materials for selling. In the future, Shirkhan wants to recruit an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy more types of materials for selling.

loans.name: Bleama Tesaa Group

texts.en:
The Group Blema Tesaa (rock of Ages) is made up of six members. The group representative is named Deborah. The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood and sell retail goods such as firewood, cloth, slippers and bags. 

Sixty-year-old Deborah did not attend school. She is single with one dependent child who is receiving an education and who lives under his mother's care. Deborah is responsible for the various expenses of her household. In order to provide for her family, Deborah has been selling firewood for the past 12 years. This business generates revenue that helps her to meet her various needs as well as those of her child. Deborah buys her supplies from the villages. 

This will be the third time she has sought a loan from ID-Ghana, along with the other members of the Blema Tesaa Group. This loan will help her grow her business and increase her revenue. The first two loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: To buy firewood from the villagers and sell it in the city.

loans.name: Rosalia Tomas

texts.pt:
A Sr. Rosalina de 49 anos de idade, casada e mae de 2 filhos. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da primeira necessidade a mais de 20 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar ( feijao,amendoim,açucar, sal, arroz, oleo e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
No futuro pretende vender produtos a grosso visto que agora trabalha numa merciaria pequena.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosalina is 49 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She's an informal trader who has been selling basic necessity products for more than 20 years.

This loan will be used to buy beans, peanuts, sugar, salt, rice, oil and other diverse products, to increase the volume of sales in her business.

In future she intends to sell products wholesale seeing as she now works in a small grocery store.

loans.use: buy beans, peanuts, sugar, salt, rice, oil and other diverse products, to increase the volume of sales in her business.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Otilia de 39 anos de idade solteira e mae de 1 filho que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ela è funcionaria do Estado a mais de 12 anos.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (chapas de zinco, tinta para pintura da casa e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio terminar a sua casa e melhorar as condicoes habitacionais e da dieta alimentar do seu filho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Otilia is 39 years old, single and the mother of 1 son who is attending primary school. She has been a civil servant for more than 12 years.

With this loan she will buy construction materials (sheets of zinc, paint and payment for labour) to continue the building work on her home.

Her greatest challenge is to finish her house and improve her son's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sheets of zinc, paint and payment for labour) to continue the building work on her home

loans.name: Orilieta

texts.pt:
A Sr. Orilieta de 31 anos de idade, casada e mae de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è negociante informal de produtos basicos e roupas usadas.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para  comprar ( arroz, oleo, roupas usadas,acucar e mais diversos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu estabelicimento comercial.
No futuro espera adquirir outros fundos na Hluvuku para melhorar as condicoes habitacionais e adieta alimentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orilieta is 31 years old, married and the mother of 3 children who go to school (primary and high school). She's an informal trader of basic goods and used clothes.

With this loan she will buy rice, oil, used clothes, sugar and other products to increase the volume of business at her commercial establishment.

In future she hopes to solicit further funds from Hluvuku to improve her family's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, used clothes, sugar and other products to increase the volume of business at her commercial establishment.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A Sr. Isabel de 38 anos de idade, solteira mae de 1 filho menor de idade que nao frequenta a escola. Ela è escrituaria na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 4 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, varoes, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande sonho compra de uma viatura para facilitar a deslocacao de casa para o servico e vice-versa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel is 38 years old and the single mother of 1 small son who doesn't go to school. She has worked in admin at the large banana company for more than 4 years.

With this loan she will buy construction materials (bricks, cement, rods, beams) and pay for labour to continue building her house.

Her greatest dream is to buy a vehicle to facilitate getting back and forth from her home to her place of business.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, rods, beams) and pay for labour to continue building her house.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.pt:
A Sr. Herminia de 52 anos de idade, casada e mae de 7 filhos dos quais todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è negociante informal  a mais de 22 anos, seus produtos sao adquiridos na vizinha Africa do Sul e vende na sua casa e por encomenda.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijao,arroz, oleo, carnes) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu estabelicimento comercial.
No futuro espera criar uma empresa de montagem de mesa de bilhares, e tem como grande desafio garantir e sustentar escola dos filhos para que nao tenha um futuro dificil.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia is 52 years old, married and the mother of 7 children who all go either to primary school or to high school. She has been an informal trader for more than 22 years and she buys her products from neighbouring South Africa to sell from her home or by custom order.

With this loan she will buy essential products such as beans, rice, oil and meats to increase the volume of business at her commercial establishment.

In future she hopes to have a business setting up pool tables and her biggest challenge is to support her children in their education so that they don't have a difficult future.

loans.use: buy essential products such as beans, rice, oil and meats to increase the volume of business at her commercial establishment.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a single woman who has no children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), Anastacia wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and mayonnaise to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp and an energy saving jiko

loans.name: Bint Ndawa

texts.en:
This is Bint Ndawa. She appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used for her mat and basket weaving business.

She would like to purchase bundles of reeds for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reeds for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 40 years old. She is married to Nicholas and together they have been blessed with three children of 12, 11 and 5 years. Nicholas helps in supporting his family financially.

Virginia is a beautician. She runs a salon in Kisumu which she has operated for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

Virginia has requested for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000  which she will use to purchase a salon blow drier and hair products such as hair oils, relaxers and treatment. With the anticipated profits, Virginia will be able to join a college in order to further her education.

Virginia's hopes and dreams is to have an improved lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a salon blow drier and hair products.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a cosmetics shop at the market in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, shampoo, braids and weaves. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

She aspires to owning a fully stocked retail shop . She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care and being friendly. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and  piped water. Her monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: To buy relaxers, treatments, shampoo and braids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salon products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Clementina dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, 10 kgs of beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, 10 kgs of beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a farmer from Aregnadem village of the Shirak region. She lives there with her husband, mother-in-law and two daughters. Anahit also has a son who lives in Russian Federation. The family is fully engaged in farming and animal husbandry. They cultivate wheat, barley and grow various types of fruits. As for animal breeding they are mainly involved in cattle keeping. 

Anahit plans to expand the family's agribusiness by making some investments. She has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her agribusiness, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Anahit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. With the loan's help, she wants to buy one cow, pay for 300 liters of fuel and 15 bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (1 cow), fuel (300 liters) and fertilizers (15 bags)

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 42-years-old and supports five people in his family. He is married to Pauline and together they have been blessed with three children of 16, 13 and 2 years. Pauline provides additional income to her family.

Thomas runs a retail shop, a business he has done for the last six years earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. He has requested his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 50,000, which he intends to use to buy stock of retail items for sale.

With the anticipated profits, Thomas will be able to diversify his business further. His hopes and dreams for the future are that his business and family will be stable and he will be a self-sustained man.

loans.use: to add stock of retail items

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She sells yellow bananas at the market and has been in this business for 6 years.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas.  She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

She aspires to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches yellow bananas

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of chicks and poultry feed for her business. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of chicks and poultry feed for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30-years-old.  He is married to Lilian and together they have been blessed with one child who is four-years-old.

Stephen sells furniture, a business he has done for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. Stephen has requested his sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 100,000 after successfully repaying his previous loans.  He will use this amount to purchase furniture like tables, chairs and sofa sets.This will be his stock for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Stephen will be able to expand his business further.  His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and family.

loans.use: to add stock of furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken, meat, fish, pig feet, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase salt and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with three children and all her children go to school. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for a year. She gets additional income from operating a restaurant on a retail basis.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more passion fruits, onions, cabbages, tomatoes and watermelons. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

She aspires to expanding her restaurant business so as to serve her customers better.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy passion fruits, onions, cabbages, tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish, chicken, meat, pig's feet, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a mother of four residing in the expansive Mukuru informal settlements in Nairobi, Kenya. She runs a school in the slum which has a very large population. However, her school lacks essential facilities for sanitation. This challenged her to look for a solution to this impending issue. 

Nancy learnt about Fresh Life toilets and thought it would be a perfect solution to her issue. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. The facilities will go a long way in ensuring that pupils at the school are comfortable and are not put at risk of contracting sanitation-related ailments. She hopes to add more facilities as her institution grows.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with seven children, and six of her children go to school. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

She operates a food stall at the market and has been in this business for 18 years. She sells her food on a retail basis. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cassava, sweet potatoes, garlic, onions and ginger. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

In the future she aspires to build more houses.

loans.use: To buy ginger, onions, garlic, sweet potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as enthusiastic. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area fit for business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is married with five children and all her children go to school.

She sells yellow bananas at the market and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. She works for seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Nulu aspires to build a rental house. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Philipina

texts.en:
Philipina is a single mother of three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food café business, selling from home to passersby and neighbours. She dreams of establishing a restaurant shop in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
The group Mandzaano is one of the most experienced in fish business. Almost all members are into the fishing business.

Their long-time involvement in this group has allowed them to develop a spirit of oneness which has enabled them to face many situations. The group members work for the most part in small-scale commerce.

George is the featured borrower of the group. He is 36 years old, married, and a father of three children.

George is very involved in the sale of fishing nets and fishing ropes. He buys from the market and sells them to the fishermen, he is fisherman himself.

With this loan, he is going to buy more fishing nets and ropes to sell to his colleague fishermen.

Earnings from this business will allow him to save and to actively take care of her family's expenses related to health, food, and his children.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and ropes to sell to his colleague fishermen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy caustic and oil.

loans.name: Olipha

texts.en: Olipha is a married woman with two children and describes herself as self-driven. She operates a retail business selling drinks, washing soap, cooking fat and other items. In business for seven years, Olipha is located in an area fit for business. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more sugar, cooking fat, washing soap and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. In the future she hopes that she will be happy and have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Olipha

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Olipha, who is a 22-year-old, hardworking and passionate farmer who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya - an area that has good weather patterns that favor farming activities. Olipha is the mother of 2 adorable kids whom she refers to as the “apple of her eye” . 

Olipha has a wealth of experience in farming. She has been farming for the past 10 years, and through the profits from her farming she has been able to take care of her family and has always provided food for them. She practises mixed farming and has realized that there is a big demand for poultry products in her village and the towns nearby, so she wants to take full advantage of the situation. This is why she is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start poultry farming. Through poultry farming Olipha will be able to fully satisfy the demand for poultry in her village and reap more profits.

By investing in Olipha, you will be able to transform her life and also the lives of the people living around her. In the next year she sees herself having established a very big poultry farming business that will be able to employ a few people from the village and hence have an impact on their lives.

Through profits made from selling eggs and poultry products, she is sure that she will be able to repay the loan on time and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Lima Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, en la Provincia de Cusco  y Departamento de Cusco.

 La socia Teresa tiene 42 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a realizar masajes ,terapias de relajación entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja a domicilio y a la vez tiene un centro de masajes por el centro de la ciudad, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a  su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
 La socia solicita el crédito para su uso personal como bienes de consumo.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, venta de antenas, realizar eventos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 42, is a member of Santa Rosita de Lima Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

She has two children and is married.  She alternates her daily activities with her job giving massages, relaxation therapy, and so on.  She has made a living in this business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She works at home and also has a massage center near downtown.  She wants to be able to keep on working and supporting her family.

This loan is part of a line of credit with Asociación Arariwa.  The Credit Yapa line of credit is granted to borrowers with a good credit history, as is characteristic of this group. 

She's requesting the loan for personal use, such as consumer goods.  She's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments punctually.

The other members work selling clothing, selling antennas, and putting on events.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old. He is married to Winnie, and they have been blessed with children who are older than two. Winnie provides additional income for the family.

Robert sells groceries, a business he has done for two years, earning a monthly income of 1,000 KES. For his second loan from VisionFund Kenya, Robert has requested 7,500 KES, which he will use to purchase groceries for resale. He successfully repaid his first loan.

Robert will use the anticipated profits from the loan to improve his family's standard of living. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business into new areas.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream, spray, powder, rubber dishes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be future oriented. 

She operates a cereals business where she sells maize, beans, and millet. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed in her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy locks, grease, rock, iron, etc.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna is 40 years old and lives in her mother-in-law's house with her husband and son. She owns a food stall in which she sells Mexican food. She started because a friend invited her, but she liked the work and thought it was a good business.

Reyna says that her business is doing well. She has many returning clients, and now she is asking for a loan to open a second location. She will use the loan to refurbish the new stall.

Reyna describes herself as hardworking and responsible. She likes to pay her loans on time. Her biggest accomplishment is providing financial stability for her family. After opening a second branch, she will buy a piece of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to refurbish a food stall to open a second location.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 27 years old. She is married to Joseph and together they have been blessed with two girls of 7 years and 2 years respectively.

She sells second-hand clothes, a business she has done for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Pauline has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children as well as expand her business further. Pauline's dreams and desires are to expand her business by opening a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beauty salon products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be humble. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bricks. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be heavy rains that make work difficult. 

Daniel will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy materials for making bricks. 

His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks

loans.name: Yunis

texts.en:
Yunis is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest and kind. 

Yunis operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Yunis will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and other items. 

Her business goal is to have a larger grocery store within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil.

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
All the five women of the Onua Do (There is love in Togetherness) Group are on average, 34 years old, and live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They know one another through neighborhood and business connections. The women sell high quality clothing, charcoal, second-hand clothing, phone card credits, pastries, cassava dough, maize, yam, and chicken.

As the women would all like to increase their working capital, they have decided to work with the field partner, ID-Ghana. This will be their fifth group loan.

Patricia is a well-known retailer of  phone card credit and fruits. She plans to use her loan to buy more phone card credit and fruits, wholesale from the main market. She will resell them on the pavement at Teshie to customers.

Patricia expects to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the needs of her household. She is married and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more phone card credits and fruits

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be business-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. 

Her business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Hanson

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Hanson, a 27-year-old, energetic, brave and humble man who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya - an area that is very fertile and always receives plenty of rainfall. The major cash crop grown in the Nyamira area is banana, and that is why this region is nicknamed “banana region”. 

Hanson is a caring father of 3 adorable kids and he has been farming for the past 3 years. Through farming he has been able to take care of his children and family. Hanson also does business so that he can make ends meet and increase his profit levels. Through these ventures, he has always brought food back home and earned an honest living. He is a very hardworking man, and sells his produce in the market and also to his neighbors so that he is able to make more money. 

One challenge that he is currently facing involves getting his products to the market on time. Because of the poor road network and poor feeder roads, the products are no longer fresh when they reach the market. This means that Hanson must sell them at a throw-away price, hence not getting maximum profit. Products such as milk, fruit and vegetables require a timely delivery to market, and for this reason Hanson is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to buy a motorbike that will assist him in getting his products to market faster. He is sure of reaping more profit because his products will be fresh and will fetch more money. 

With improved profits, Hanson will be able to assure his children of a brighter future and also improve his living conditions. Having gone through and understood the repayment schedule, he is sure that he will be able to repay the loan on time and increase his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike so that he can get his produce to market faster

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets, slippers and food containers for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables, palm oil and coal nuts for resale.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa trabaja en una droguería todos los días como vendedora buscando llevar el sustento para su hogar. Ya que es madre soltera y la única fuente de ingresos es ésta, trabaja incansablemente para brindarle a su hijo de 7 años todo lo que necesita.
Ella desea ser independiente y comenzar con un negocio que le permita compartir más tiempo con su hijo y estar más pendiente de él; por eso solicita un aliento económico para la realizar la compra de una estantería y productos básicos de la canasta familiar para montar su tienda en el municipio de Puerto Triunfo.
Siempre se ha caracterizado por una mujer luchadora que no se vence fácilmente ante los obstáculos y quiere enseñarle a su hijo que el mejor camino para encontrar el éxito es la disciplina y perseverancia.
texts.en:
Luisa works in a pharmacy every day as a salesperson to support her household. Since she is a single mother and this is her only source of income, she works tirelessly to give her 7-year-old son everything he needs. 
She wants to be independent and start a business that allows her to spend more time with her son and keep a better eye on him. This is why she is requesting some economic assistance to purchase shelves and the basic staples of the typical pantry in order to set up her store in the town of Puerto Triunfo. 
She has always been a determined woman who is not easily overcome by obstacles, and she wants to teach her son that the best way to success is through discipline and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy shelves and stock products to start her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, pure water and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls and plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Onua Do 2 Group

texts.en:
The Group Onua Do 2 ("There is Love in Togetherness") is made up of four members. The group representative is named Bernard. The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood and are into goat, yam, wax-print, provisions and slippers businesses. 

Thirty-three-year-old Bernard attended school to the secondary level. He is married with three children, who are receiving an education and who live under their parents' care. Bernard is responsible for the various expenses in his household. In order to do this, Bernard has been selling goats and yams for the past nine years. This business generates revenue, which helps him to meet his various needs, as well as those of his family. Bernard gets his supplies from the villages. 

This will be the fifth time he has sought a loan from ID-Ghana, along with the other members of the Onua Do 2 Group. This loan will help him grow his business and increase his turnover and revenue. The previous loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: To buy goats and yams from the villages to sell in the city.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jean skirts and tights.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 51-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 4 children aged 32, 30, 28 and 22 years. In 2006, she established her baby clothing business, which she began because she wants to help her husband with some responsibilities. Her business is located close to a children’s hospital in the outskirts of town and her main customers are pregnant women and suckling mothers. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month. Fatmata requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy more diapers, baby oil, baby powder and napkins for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to meet the demand of her customers. She plans to develop and build her own shop and to educate her children up to a university level. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy more baby items.

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children who are still at school. She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 4 pm to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Sophia's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to to buy drinks, two refrigerators, chairs and empty crates of beers and sodas. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy drinks and to open another grocery store.  She dreams of owning a clothing shop.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group "WEGA" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks and to open another grocery store.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Fatu. She is married and has 3 children aged 25, 22 and 20. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her and give her sales assistance. In 1980, Fatu established her textile business. She began her business because she was not educated and wanted to help herself. Working 7 days a week and 18 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bales of cotton fabric for resale. In the future, Fatu plans to build a house on her land. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of cotton fabric for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets, and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Devotha is a mother of three children, two sons and one daughter, all of them schooling. She is in her early forties. She works selling beers, sodas, water and spirits. She has been in this business for three years. Devotha sells from 1:00 pm until after midnight and is able to make a good profit each month. 

She is requesting her seventh credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has really seen the loan impact because she retained more customers after replenishing her grocery with more drinks. She is so thankful for Kiva's support. Devotha used the previous credits, since repaid, to improve her business (bought more drinks). She earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and part of home food expenses. She is now requesting another credit which she will use to replenish beers, sodas and water to resell. Her desire is to manage a hardware business. 

Devotha and two other Ulezi group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish beers, sodas and water to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buy more coal.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a hard-working married man with three children, aged 17, 14, and 10 years old, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income. He started this business to educate his children. He faces a challenge of seasonal markets for his products. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer and educating his children to higher levels of education. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Yoona

texts.en:
Yoona is a sixty year old hardworking man living in Kamwenge- Uganda.  He is a farmer where he practices cattle fattening and that is where he earns a living for his family, though he also carries out farming to earn an extra income. He was encouraged to start this business to earn more income for better standards of living. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand, however he has a vision of expanding his business to bigger markets.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty year-old hard working married man with three children, living in Kamwenge- Uganda. He deals in the selling of clothes as his main source of income alongside farming and a tailoring school for extra income. He was inspired to start this business to increase his income and have a better living with his family. He faces challenges of competition, seasonal customers and weather changes that stop customers from turning up but has hopes that in future he will own a wholesale boutique.

He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, onions and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Allison

texts.en:
Allison is a 26-year-old single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a wholesale shop as her main source of income. It is from this business that she has been able to sustain herself. High rental and license fees are problems she complains of. She hopes to expand her business by opening up branches in other trading centers around Kamwenge.

She is requesting a loan to buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en:
Posiano is a 45-year-old hardworking married man with four children, age 10, 8, 7, and 5 years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in farming as his main source of income though he also carries out brick making to earn an extra income. He started this business to educate his children. He faces a challenge of seasonal markets for his products. He has a vision of becoming a modern farmer and educating his children to higher levels of education. 

Posiano is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Maysaramo

texts.ru: Майсарамо веселая, добрая и отзывчивая мама из района Хамадони. У нее четверо детей, трое сыновей и одна дочь. Майсарамо замужем, но ее муж находиться за приделами страны на заработках, как и большинство мужчин сел и деревень. Она сама занимается воспитанием детей. Майсарамо 40 лет. Она работает швеей у себя дома. Майсарамо берет заказы на кройку и шитье женской одежды. Такая работа для нее является очень удобной. Она всегда может заниматься домашними делами, а также не выходя из дома зарабатывать. Майсарамо занимается такой деятельностью давно и ее швейная машинка совсем устарела. Ей не хватает денег для приобретения новой машинки, и она просит кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку.
texts.en: Maysaramo is a cheerful, kind and sympathetic mother in Hamadoni. She has four children, three sons and one daughter. Maysaramo is married, but, like most village men, her husband is working out of the country. She is raising the children. Maysaramo is forty years old. She works from home as a seamstress. Maysaramo takes custom orders for making women's clothing. This work is very convenient. She can always do house work and make money from home. Maysaramo has been doing this a long time, and her sewing machine is outdated. She does not have enough money to purchase a new machine, and she is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine to preserve her source of income.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий с женой и тремя дочерьми живет в Водяное. Он занимается выращиванием помидоров и огурцов на собственном участке вот уже 10 лет. Имеет две большие отапливаемые теплицы и отдельную теплицу для рассады. Василий с детства привык трудиться на земле. После армии работал на АЭС два года. Но потом все равно вернулся к земледелию, это ему больше по душе. Хозяйство у Василия всегда в порядке. 
Сумму в 40 000 гривен Василий планирует вложить в ремонт теплицы, ремонт системы отопления, а также в закупку пленки и нужных по сезону семян. Со временем планирует сделать хорошее отопление для теплиц на своем участке, что давно стало необходимостью, а также переделать теплицы, сделав их выше.
texts.en: Vasiliy lives in Vodyanoye with his wife and three daughters. For ten years, he has been growing tomatoes and cucumbers on his own land.  He has two large heated greenhouses and a separate greenhouse for seedlings. Since childhood, Vasiliy has worked the earth. After serving in the army he worked at a factory for two years. But he still went back to farming which is more to his liking. Vasiliy's farm is always in order. Vasiliy plans to invest 40,000 hyrvinia in greenhouse repair, repairing heating systems, and buying film and the right seeds for the season. Over time, he plans install a good heating system for the greenhouses as well as raising the greenhouses.

loans.use: construct a greenhouse with heating and buy plastic film and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bottles for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power Solar Lighting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for the National Holidays

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro de 37 años de edad,  no estudio en el tiempo cuando ella estaba pequeña la formación académica no era de mucha importancia. Se casó y tienen una familia de 5 hijos los cuales viven con ella y dependen económicamente de ellos, su esposo viajo a EE.UU a trabajar para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia trabaja en una constructora y envía dinero a su familia,  sus hijos están todos en la escuela ninguno trabaja. 

Ella está al cuidado de sus hijos y trabaja la milpa ya tiene 5 años de haber iniciado esta actividad económica que aprendió con sus padres.

El lugar de trabajo le queda cerca de su casa, camina 20 minutos para llegar sus hijos le ayudan en tiempos que no van a la escuela, con el préstamo comprara arena, cemento, grava, hierro, para terminar de construir su casa y así vivir en un lugar más seguro y tranquilo. 

Ella planea seguir mejorando su casa y que sus hijos salgan adelante y que se puedan preparar académicamente, ella está segura que el préstamo le ayudara para tener una casa más segura y que la comodidad para su familia sea mejor.
texts.en:
Milagro is 37 years old. She did not study. When she was small, academic study was not very important. She is married and has 5 children who live with her and are financially dependent on her. Her husband traveled to the USA to work in order to be able to provide a better quality of living for his family. He works in construction and sends money to his family. The children are all in school, none of them work.

Milagro is taking care of her children and growing corn. She has five years experience doing this activity which she learned from her parents. The place where she works is close to her house and she walks there in 20 minutes. Her children help her when they are not in school.

She will buy cement, sand, gravel and re-bar with the loan so that she can finish constructing her house and live in a more secure and quiet place. She plans to continue to improve the house and she wants her children to get ahead and prepare themselves academically. She is certain that the loan will help her have a more secure and comfortable house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, and re-bar to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Twizigire Group

texts.fr:
Apollinaire fait partie du groupe Twizigire et  habite à Gitega. C’est un veuf de  2 enfants, l’un a 6 ans et l’autre 18 ans. 

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 20 ans.  

Il est à son quatrième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et   acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Apollinaire is a member of the Twizigire group and lives in Gitega. He is a widow with two children, a 6 year old and an 18 year old.

He has been selling clothing for 20 years.

This is his fourth loan with Turame. He will use the loan to increase his capital and buy a lot of clothing that he can resell to earn more.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a lot of clothing that he can resell to earn more.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerado is 59 years old, he is married, and has seven children; three are independent and four still live with him. He has worked in retail for more than 20 years. Gerardo started selling chocolates, then candles, and for the last 20 years he has been selling clothes. He  works from Monday to Saturday, and has many recurring clients. Most of his clients come directly to his house to buy the clothes; he sells both wholesale and retail. 

He is asking for a loan to buy clothes for men, women and children.

His biggest accomplishment is building his house and cueing a car.

loans.use: To buy men's, women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new air conditioner and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola inicio con su negocio de cafetería en una de las instituciones educativas del municipio de Sonsón gracias a la ayuda y motivación que le dio un amigo y hasta ahora lleva 8 años en esta actividad.
En la cafetería ofrece productos como tinto, aromáticas, chocolate, gaseosas, frituras y alimentos que ella misma prepara a los alumnos y profesores que diariamente llegan allí para disfrutar su una merienda.
Ella muy amablemente los atiende a todos con una sonrisa en su rostro.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos y de insumos para sus preparaciones, adicionalmente desea comprar una nevera para almacenar carnes y gaseosas.
Con esta ayuda podrá continuar con su labor, labor que le ha permitido sentirse fuerte e independiente además de poder sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Paola started her cafe business in one of the education institutions in the town of Sonsón thanks to the help and motivation that a friend gave her, and so far has spent 8 years in this job.  In the cafe, she offers products like coffee, herbal tea, chocolate, soft drinks, fried foods and other food items that she prepares herself for the students and professors who come there daily to enjoy a snack.  She very kindly tends to everyone with a smile on her face.

Right now she asks for a loan so that she can buy products and supplies for her preparations.  Additionally, she wants to buy a fridge to store meats and soft drinks.  With this help, she would be able to continue her work; work that has allowed her to feel strong and independent in addition to being able to support her household.

loans.use: to buy products and supplies for her preparations, and to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una joven trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está estudiando la carrera Universitaria de Contabilidad y actualmente trabaja como Asistente Contable en una prestigiosa empresa. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable, honesta y sobre todo porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace para obtener resultados favorables.
Maria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora para que de esta manera pueda realizar mejor sus trabajos de la oficina y pueda mejorar su labor. Gracias a esto seguirá esforzándose para poder terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking young woman. She is 21 years old, single, and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho along with her family.

She is a person very eager to get ahead. She studies accounting at the university, and currently works as an accounting assistant at a prestigious company. She does very well because she is enterprising, hardworking, responsible, and honest. Most of all, she always puts her best effort into everything she does, in order to get positive results.

Maria is thankful to Kiva lenders because with the support they provide she will be able to buy a computer that will help with her office tasks and help her improve her work. Thanks to this, she will continue working to complete her university studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son who is 13 years old. She has work in trade for more than 10 years; her parents introduced her to the business. She started by helping them, and later Ofelia started buying merchandise, mostly jewelry, and now she has a thriving business. She sells mostly in flea markets from Thursday to Sunday. 

Ofelia is asking for a loan to buy merchandise; she says that by providing more variety to her clients, she can increase sales and profits.

Her biggest accomplishment is growing her business and securing locations in different markets.  She was also able to buy a car, and make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and an air cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an electric scissor and a generator.

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato.  Se casó su esposa es ama de casa realiza los quehaceres del hogar, son padres de tres hijos que están estudiando.

José trabaja como motorista en una moto-taxi ya hace 3 años que empezó a dedicarse a esto y se decidió dedicar a esta actividad económica porque comprobó que era rentable y le va muy bien.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar repuestos y accesorios para reparar unos desperfectos que tiene su equipo de trabajo y así tenerla en buenas condiciones para trabajar y no perder oportunidades de obtener ingresos económicos que servirán para los gastos de hogar y que su calidad de vida no se vea afectada y tendrá su medio de transporte de pasajeros bien bonito y en buen estado.

Él piensa a futuro poder preparar académicamente a su tres hijos y seguir trabajando con su moto-taxi y con las ganancias que le van quedando cancelar el crédito y en un futuro no muy lejano comprar otra moto-taxi y trabajarla para que sus ingresos aumenten y tener una mejor calidad de vida y también remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old and studied through high school. He is married and his wife takes care of household matters. The two are parents of 3 children who are all in school.

Jose has driven a moto-taxi [shown above] for the last 3 years since taking up this line of work. He adopted this economic activity when he noted its profitability. Things are going very well for him.

Jose needs this loan to purchase replacement parts and accessories for repairing some defects in his moto-taxi and, thus, to have good working conditions without losing opportunities to obtain the income needed to cover household expenses. He doesn't want their quality of life to decline and he wants to continue to have a means of transporting passengers very well and in good condition.

In the future, Jose wishes to prepare his 3 children academically and to continue working with his moto-taxi. With his earnings he will pay off this loan and, in the not so distant future, purchase another moto-taxi and use it to augment his income and have a better quality of life and, also, he wants to remodel his house.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and accessories to repair some  defects in his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys una muy trabajadora mujer de 52 años de edad que ve siempre oportunidades para progresar y generar dinero para ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento del hogar y darse sus propios gustos como abuela caprichosa que es pro dicha razón trabaja diariamente ofertando servicios de almuerzos, desayunos, cenas, y comidas típicas colombianas como lo son la morcilla y tamales. 
Quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar herramientas de trabaja y adecuar de mejor manera su hogar para sus servicios de hospedaje el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ollas grandes, televisor, colchones microondas, freidor de gas, y materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos. 
A pesar de edad es muy trabajadora y siempre quiere lo mejor para su familia pues ayuda a hermanas y a su hijo en gastos universitarios abriendo su hogar a personas desconocidas que llegan con la necesidad de un techo para dormir. 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo y ofrecer un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very hard-working 52 year old woman. She always sees opportunities to progress and generate money to help her husband maintain the household. She also wants to fulfill her own desires as a capricious grandmother. For these reasons she works daily offering her service of lunches, breakfasts, dinners and typical Colombian dishes such as blood sausage and tamales.

She wants to request a loan to buy work tools and outfit her home with better hospitality services. She will invest the loan buying large pots, a TV, microwave ovens, a gas fryer and raw material to make her meals. Despite her age she is very hard-working and always wants the best for her family. She helps her sisters and her son with university expenses. She opens her house to strangers who need a roof to sleep under. Her dream is to continue to grow and offer better service to all her clients.

loans.use: to buy large pots, a TV, microwave ovens, a gas fryer and raw material to make her meals.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miguelina, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de ropa como blusas, chompas y pantalones, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, aceite entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO” communal bank which is located in Cusco district, in the Province and Department of the same name.

Miguelina is one of the members. She continues with her business which is a grocery store. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, sweets, amongst others. At the same time she continues to sell clothing like blouses, sweaters and pants. She had had her business for a long time which is going well thanks to the determination she applies to her work each day. The member wants to continue working like this in order to continue to support her family. Miquelina is is requesting a loan to purchase milk and oil amongst others.

The other members work in businesses like a book store, selling clothing, a grocery store, and a restaurant. The person with the blanked out face does not belong to the the communal bank. The member is grateful to those that form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay her installments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy milk and oil amongst others.

loans.name: Nene Galle's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mise en place le 27 Juin 2008 lors l’inauguration du  banc villageois. Il est composé femmes qui malgré enclavement du village ont su faire plus de 05 ans dans le programme et acquérir une solide expérience dans le système. Elles habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Néné (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 39 et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et un garçon. Elle est gérante de boutique dans son village, elle sa marchandise en gros et demi gros au marché central de la commune ou au grand marché hebdomadaire  pour la revente au détail dans son village. Elle a une grande expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter du riz pour 100 000 Fr CFA, de l’huile pour 52 500 Fr CFA, de l’ognon et divers bouillons culinaires.

Avec les profits réalisés, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille (nourriture, santé), et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was set up on June 27, 2008, the day of the inauguration of the ’banc villageois’. It is composed of women  who, despite the village’s isolation, figured out what to do in the program more than five years ago and who acquired solid experience in the system. The women all live in the same village. They all have small-scale businesses and work in agriculture during the rainy season. 

Ms. Néné (sitting at the far right with a hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 39 years old, and a mother of four children (3 girls and 1 boy). She is the manager of a store in her village. She [purchases] her merchandise wholesale and demi-wholesale at the commune’s central weekly market and then resells the goods retail in her village. She has a lot of experience in this domain.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase rice for 100,000 francs CFA; oil for 52,500 francs; some onions; and a various flavorings.

With the profits made, she plans on improving her family's living conditions (food, healthcare) and increasing her savings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, onions, and various flavorings

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es una persona de 25 años de edad, Soltero, quien tiene un hijo varón, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad principal es la herrería, diseño de estructuras metálicas y carpintería, donde elabora  puertas, ventanas, balcones y persianas, actividad que fue desarrollando tras siete años de experiencia y capacitación, su mercado meta son las comunidades vecinas, donde obtiene la mayoría de sus ingresos para poder sostener a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,500.00 para la compra de materiales de herrería y carpintería. La meta que tiene es poder ampliar su negocio por medio de sucursales y poder llegar a ofrecer su trabajo a otras comunidades.
texts.en:
Manuel is 25 years old and single. He has a son, and they live in the department of Sololá. 

He is a blacksmith, designer of metal structures, and carpenter. He makes doors, windows, balconies, and blinds, and has seven years of experience and training. His target market is the neighboring communities, which is where he earns most of the income that sustains his family and improves their living conditions.

He requests a loan of 7,500 quetzals to buy materials for metalworking and carpentry. His goal is to expand his business to include additional locations, and to be able to offer his work to other communities.

loans.use: to buy materials for metalworking and carpentry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electric products and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over-sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking items like pots, pans, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Guadalupe Uno Group

texts.en:
Guadalupe Uno is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank located in Cantel, Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. As soon as the ten women finished paying off their previous loan, they immediately applied for another one. They hope that it will be funded by Kiva lenders. The ladies are most eager to continue to invest in their small businesses, so that they can meet the needs of their families. Most work in textile production and create beautiful pieces of embroidery, by hand and machine. These pieces are sewn into aprons, blouses and purses.

Carmelina is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 36 years of age and married to a bricklayer. The couple has four children, and three of them are enrolled in school. Carmelina has a small convenience store that she keeps stocked with items for daily consumption. She is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase inventory, including rice, noodles, sugar, butter, oil, juices and soda. She opens her store at 7 a.m. and stays open until 9 p.m. She said that her previous loan helped her to maintain and increase her business. This hard-working woman is positive that she can do even better. The income that Carmelina generates greatly helps her to improve the standard of living for the family, and to support her children’s education.

The women of the Trust Bank Guadalupe Uno are happy to report that they enjoy the monthly trainings given by a Friendship Bridge loan officer. They learn about business administration, money management, marketing and, in the last three months, they have discussed topics like empowerment and domestic violence, as well as children’s education. This group is very active and likes to participate during the training sessions. This helps to them gain confidence in themselves and raise their self-esteem!

The women of Guadalupe Uno would like to thank Kiva lenders, for their kindness and generosity in providing capital for the loans. They are most appreciative of the confidence that the lenders have in their ability to improve their lives. They look forward to a brighter future, as empowered women eliminating poverty!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kitchen supplies and accessories and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: El Milagro 4 Group

texts.en:
Leonida is the group coordinator for El Milagro 4 (The Miracle 4) Group. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her home is a compound for her two children. She is taking care of them alone, since she is a single mother. The other members run different businesses, selling miscellaneous products such as clothes and food.

This is Leonida's 10th loan. She sells cosmetics, from her home and by walking around her community and others. Also, she sells wholesale to minor customers. She would like to continue expanding her business, by increasing her inventory to attract more customers and sell more products. She will use this loan to buy different kinds of cosmetics, like body lotion, perfume, hand cream, deodorant, face cream, and many others.

Leonida says she enjoys doing business. and her most important dream is to expand her business. She started the business on her own, with her first Esperanza loan five years ago, and she has reinvested and increased her sales over time. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy different kinds of cosmetics to sell, like body lotion, perfume, and hand cream

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres et gagne en expérience dans le programme vu qu’elles viennent d’entamer leur quatrième cycle. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama  (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants  (01 garçon et 01 fille). Elle vend des légumes frais et poisson sec et séché au marché de son quartier où elle tient une table. Cette activité elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années. Elle se procure les légumes auprès des femmes productrices ou revendeurs au marché central régional.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter un panier de 60 Kg de poisson séché et un de poisson sec, des légumes frais quotidiennement et un bidon d’huile de palme de 20 litre en vu de diversifier son activité. 

Les bénéfices lui permettront, en plus de soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne  à la retraite dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women who are very active in this ’banc villageois’ , which was created on December 2010. The women of the group are all from the same district and get along well in solidarity. The group members are earning experience in the program, given that they just started their fourth loan cycle. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Mariama (standing at the far right with her left hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is 50 years old and a married mother of two children (a boy and a girl). She sells fresh vegetables and dried fish at the market in her district where she has a table. She has been operating this business for several years. She gets her supplies of vegetables from women producers or retailers at the regional central market.

With this loan, she intends to purchase a 60-kg basket of dried fish […], some fresh vegetables each day, and a 20-liter container of palm oil with the aim of diversifying her business. 

The profits will enable her to cover day-to-day family expenses, as well as support her retired husband.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, fresh vegetables every day, and some palm oil to diversify her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment to complement his computer repair service.

loans.name: Imitwe Group

texts.fr:
Géorgine fait partie du groupe  imitwe  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 28 ans et est marié à  Salvator, un pêcheur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 9 ans dont 2  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des oignons, des épices et du sel de cuisines  depuis 2 ans.  

Elle est à son cinquième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande quantité d’oignons, d’épices  et de sel de cuisine   à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable,  devenir une importatrice et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Géorgine is part of the group Imitwe and lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and married to Salvator, a fisherman. Together they have four children, from 2 to 9 years old, of whom two are students.

Géorgine has been doing commerce in onions and table salt for two years.

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of onions, spices, and table salt to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase arable land, to become an importer, and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of onions, spices, and table salt to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Modelo De La Comunidad Group

texts.en:
Model of the Community
Costa Rica, Tucurrique

The members of the women’s bank have been very responsible with their commitment of payment.  They confronted a special situation within their group where a partner did not pay her share on time and they assumed her payments until the final month.  They made the decision to refine the group, leaving behind the members that they considered to be a risk. 

The group is located in a rural area in which there are large problems with sources of employment.  They all used to work in an assembly factory in Tucurrique, but due to poor economic conditions, it closed, leaving the community without opportunities for jobs.  This forced the women to support their household budgets by generating income from the sale of textile products they created.  They now devote themselves to sewing and fabricating various products.  This new loan is very important to the associates since they already have plans to carry out the development of production. 
	
For this group of three women, this is the third loan they have received.  They have equipment and sell their products in both Cartago and Turrialba, which are cities close to their homes.  With the previous loans, they have bought raw materials.  This is their third loan request, and they hope to continue to grow, as well as to support their children’s studies.
	
Zelmira, the president of the group, has two daughters that are in school and live with her husband.  She is dedicated to making curtains, pillows and blankets that are sold in the cities previously mentioned.  She has 20 years of experience working with sewing machines and her products are of very high quality.  She supports her children’s studies and contributes money for household expenses in addition to investing in the business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase chicks for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase chicks for her business.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en:
Loimata is 40 years old and a married woman with five children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, noodles, soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for four years.

Loimata needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, salt, flour, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, and salt, and boxes of noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sopo

texts.en:
Sopo is 31 years old and a single woman with one child. 

She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for three years. Sopo has requested a loan to buy fishing net, spears, torch, goggles, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sopo hopes her business will help her family's living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, spears, torch, goggles, etc.

loans.name: Jimy Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jimy es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de medicinas, desde hace 4 años.
Don Jimy su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en el municipio donde vive y necesita el préstamo para la compra de medicinas dolor, antiinflamatorias, congestión nasal, etc.  Y seguir ofreciendo este tipo de productos que es muy demandado por sus clientes.
Don Jimy con el préstamo espera que su ventas aumenten y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos, y así poder mejorar un poco su  calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. El espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Junio del  2014
texts.en:
Jimy is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives with his family in a community in southern Honduras. His business is selling medicines, which he has been doing for four years.

Jimy carries on his business as a street vendor in the municipality where he lives. He needs the loan in order to purchase medicines for pain, inflammation, nasal congestion, etc., and to continue offering this type of product, which is in great demand by his customers.

With the loan, Jimmy hopes that his sales increase, and that he can increase his income this way and be able to improve quality of life for him and his family a bit with the increase in household income. 

In the short term, he hopes to make his business grow, and this way be able to continue to support his family and ensure that his children have the necessary education so that they can have better opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: To buy medicines for pain, inflammation, nasal congestion, etc.

loans.name: Litiaainiu

texts.en: Litiaainiu is 68 years old and married, with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for six years. Litiaainiu has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, cooking oil, spoons, etc. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Litiaainiu plans to extend her business, developing another small business different from the current one.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, cooking oil, spoons, forks, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 69-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, banana, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years. Lina has requested a loan to buy a weed  sprayer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Lina hopes to continue doing her business for the best improvement of her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Marceline
