texts.en:
Marceline previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories, and for the maintenance of their jeepney. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has had this business for more than thirty years now and she has six jeepneys.

She would now like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

As of the moment, God has  blessed her and her family so much that she can say that she is content with what she has now. She is hoping though that her grandchildren will have a good future too. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers who helped the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney – open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is a 27-year-old single dad. He settled to earn his living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Over two years, Ryan was able to manage his retail store that absolutely met the needs of his family. Until now, the store is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs. 

Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. He expects an increase in sales so as to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla plans to buy a motorcycle of their own to be used for rental and transportation services. She has a cafeteria in their village. She personally cooks the food to ensure better taste. She has her assistants that help her entertain her customers. 

Rosevilla joined GDMPC recently and she gained access to micro finance services. She borrowed a new loan to buy more raw ingredients to use to prepare food to sell. She wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients to use to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Tessie has been in this business for five years. Tessie also earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Natalia Stefanie

texts.en:
Natalia is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN). She will study commercial shipping and harbor management. Natalia wants to work in a shipping office because she is living on the coast of Java, precisely east of the city of Cilacap. Natalia has just graduated from high school and wants to continue her studies at AMN. 

Natalia's parents opened a rice shop to meet the daily needs of her family. Her parents' income is erratic at the rice stalls. So, Natalia has difficulties to finance her studies, but she did not want to bother her parents because their income is uncertain. 

Natalia wants to get a loan from Kiva to help pay for college later so that she can complete her studies and get a job quickly, and her parents can be helped with their economy.

loans.use: to pay her education fees for three years.

loans.name: Mulauvao

texts.en: Mulauvao is a 19-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Mulauvao has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread, scissors, material, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread, scissors, material, etc.

loans.name: Ailini

texts.en: Ailini is 52 years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has three years of experience in this line of business. Ailini needs a loan to buy sewing machines, material, scissors, thread, etc. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy scissors, thread, sewing machines, needles, material, etc

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda  from Sebasi, Clarin helps her  husband take care of their own farm . Arlinda has been raising coconuts and corn for many years to make a living. Aside from this, she also sells vegetables in their village. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She took  a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer, hoping to improve the farm since she wants to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lidia Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Angélica de 67 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y sus clientes son personas de la zona,  también tiene contratos con personas de otros lugares.
Doña Lidia Angélica vive en una aldea de  San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Lidia Angélica está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, cuajada, leña, manteca, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende elaborar más producto para así mejorar un poco sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Lidia Angélica su sueño es tener un gran taller de rosquillas con varias empleadas y que su hija más adelante tome el control de todo el negocio cuando ella ya no pueda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
Señora Lidia Angélica is 67 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in her own home. She has worked in a doughnut sales business for 20 years. Her customers are people from the area, and she also has contracts with people from other places.

Doña Lidia Angélica lives in a village in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to move forward, and fights every day to improve her quality of life.
 
Doña Lidia Angélica is applying for this loan to buy products such as: corn, curd, firewood, butter, etc. With the support of this loan she hopes to make more products in order to improve her income and her quality of life a little. She is a new member who is looking forward to working with Prisma.

Doña Lidia Angélica's dream is to have a large doughnut shop with various employees that her daughter could take control of when she no longer can.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, curd, firewood, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita manages a business making furniture and selling it in town, earning well for the family. For many years, Lolita has been able to sustain the business and she has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for materials needed for furniture making. She had many costumers for her gifted work and met their needs in a competitive way. 

Lolita has taken out a new loan recently to purchase additional materials for furniture making. She wants to improve her business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating coconuts, bananas and corn to sell in order to earn a living. She has successfully sustained her farm and with her income, she has been able to start a new business, raising pigs for sale. To boost her pig business, she has taken out a new loan to buy piglets and feeding supplies. In the future, Julie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeding supplies

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been growing coconuts, her main source of income, and she also has a plot of corn and bananas. Every week, she is able to deliver harvested bananas to the market to earn a living.

Irene used her previous loan for farm fertilization and weeding maintenance and has successfully repaid it. To have a larger harvest, she is taking out a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Filger

texts.en: Filger has been  running a buy-and-sell business in order to provide  the needs of his family. He is selling assorted groceries in their village to make a living. To improve sales, he borrowed a  loan to buy more goods to sell as additional inventory. In the future, Filger wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell as additional inventory

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 46-year-old micro-entrepreneur who lives in Taguig, Philippines. She has a child who is now in college. She manages their own household while operating the business through the help of her child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for herself and her child’s everyday expenses.

Gina is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sell the water per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. She also earns additional income from her rooms for rent. Her regular customers for mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

Gina hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of traveling abroad someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing notions, ready-to-wear clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lanutausala

texts.en:
Lanutausala is 40 years old and a single woman with one child. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for more than 4 years.

Lanutausala has requested a loan to buy a weedsprayer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,,Lanutausala will plan to build up another small business to gain income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a weedsprayer, bush knivies, a wheelbarrow, etc

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has six children who are attending school. Aside from farming he is also engaged in making wooden crafts that he sells in the local community. 

Due to high cost of foodstuffs and school fees, he cannot finance all the schooling of his children.  For this reason, he would like to access an educational loan of PHP 18,000 to pay for tuition fees, miscellaneous fees and a school uniform for his daughter who is taking up her Bachelor of Science in Nursing. 

Orlando believes that this financial assistance will help a lot for the education of his daughter.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, miscellaneous fees and a school uniform for his daugther

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is aged 43, married to a construction worker, and  blessed with two children. 

She has managed a hog-raising business in their village for almost two years, earning a net income of PHP 5,000 from every one hog. Her income on this business usually spent on the school fees and allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient fund in her business she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feeds for her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas and corn to earn a living. She has been selling her farm produce in town and she earns a good income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming.

Improving her farm is her passion and she never stops continuing, for she wants to ensure a better income for her family. She took a new loan recently to buy fertilizer such as manure to be used for this cropping season. She hopes to improve her business so that she can make renovations on her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria operates a tailoring business, providing general alterations and tailoring services. Together with her husband, she has sustained and improved the business and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used that loan for the business. 

To offer improved services, she has taken a new loan to buy a new sewing machine. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to expand the business as well as to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business to sell agricultural supplies. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use 20,000 KES to buy agricultural supplies. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy  agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Oglah

texts.en:
Oglah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as focused. She operates a chemist store where she sells medicines. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of medicines. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicines.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself as kind and honest. 

She operates a retail business to sell bananas. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds and an improper business stall. She will use 20,000 KES to buy bananas and materials to construct a business stall. 

Her business goal is to grow into a large fruit business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy bananas and materials to construct a business stall.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of 5. 

Ten years ago, Iram bought milking cattle. She sold the milk to her neighbors. Over time, her business expanded due to the increased demand for milk from the people living nearby. She currently has one buffalo. Iram’s pure, good quality milk is in high demand in her area. Her milk selling business generates some income to fulfill the day-to-day expenses of her family. 

Now in her 3rd loan cycle, Iram has requested 40,000 PKR to purchase anoather buffalo to increase the milk production. She is positive that this loan will help her to boost her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 25-year-old single lady. She has been successfully running a small grocery store in her town. She has 5 years of experience in this field. She has complete support of her father who also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market. 

She is in her 3rd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and now, in order to grow her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of biscuits, tea whiteners, sweets and beverages to meet the constantly increasing demand of the customers. She is a very ambitious woman and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, tea whiteners, sweets and beverages.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 26 years old and is a happily married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been working making gloves for many years and she assists her husband in his business. Her husband purchases leather from the wholesale market and makes leather gloves out of it which he sells in the nearby market. 

For many years the income generated from this business has supported Tahira and her family. However, due to lack of excess funds they are unable to expand their business and meet increasing demand of customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy good quality leather and spools of threads along with packs of needles. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes that their business will prosper and fulfill their monetary needs.

loans.use: to buy good quality leather and spools of threads along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Nuumoa

texts.en:
Nuumoa is 57 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as rice, sugar, flour, salt, drinks, snacks, etc. She has been doing this for six years. 

She needs a loan to buy a freezer, a cooler, bags of rice, bags of sugar, chicken legs, mutton flaps, boxes of noodles, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and save more for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a cooler, bags of rice, bags of sugar, chicken legs, mutton flaps, boxes of noodles, etc.

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
The Darma Sedana group feels excited. Their business in pig breeding is getting a maximal result. The price for pork now is quite high and they have a good chance to sell all the pigs. All the members earned a satisfactory profit. Because of the satisfactory profit, one member decided to resign and continue the business with her own money. She was replaced by a new member.

Ni Ketut sold all of her pigs. She earned a satisfactory profit. Now she can meet her daily needs from this effort.

The Darma Sedana group is continuing to borrow loans. The loan and the pig breeder program from MUK have proven uplifting for their lives. They can have a loan without collateral and also get training for better knowledge of the pig business.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets for fattening and also purchase superior quality feed. She hopes her piglets can grow faster. She has a plan to save all the profit for business capital.

loans.use: to purchase four superior piglets and superior quality feed

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Despite financial hardship, Ramon has the determination to uplift his family's standard of living and give them a better life. He is 57 years old and has six children in school. He and his wife manage a small eatery and retail store within the local community, but their income is not sufficient to meet the needs of their children. For this reason, he wants to take out an educational loan of 20,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees and miscellaneous fees of his son, who is taking hotel and restaurant management at Saint Bernadeth College. Having this financial assistance, Ramon believes that his son will be able to finish his chosen course.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and miscellaneous fees for his son

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as vibrant. 

He operates a retail business to sell phone accessories and repair phones. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of phone repair equipment. 

He will use 20,000 KES to purchase repair equipment. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, his business will be stable. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase phone repair equipment.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 6. He describes himself as generous. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be job security. 

He will use 20,000 KES to buy sugar, bread, and washing soap to enable him start a retail shop.  This will enable him increase his income. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread, and washing soap to enable him start a retail shop

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 43 years old, married and has three children. She engages in cooking and selling snack foods within her community. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. 

Her eldest son is now in college level while the others are in their secondary level of education. Due to the high cost of tuition fees and miscellaneous fees they could not afford to finance them all. For this reason, Melinda wants to avail herself of an educational loan of PHP 12,000 to pay for the tuition fees and miscellaneous fees of her eldest son. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to fully pay the school fees of her son.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees and miscellaneous fees of her eldest son.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en:
Patriciah is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low demand. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro-finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a responsible mother who supports her husband in gaining income. She is into a vegetable vending business within the local community. She is 48 years old and has four schooling children. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband aim to educate their children and give them a better life. 

Her eldest child is now in college taking up a Civil Engineering course. However, due to financial hardship, they can not afford to pay all his school fees. For this reason, Sylvia wants to access an educational loan from Kiva lenders through ASKI for an amount of PHP10,000 to pay for the tuition fees, school uniform and miscellaneous fees of her son. She is hoping that lenders will approve her loan request.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, school uniform and miscellaneous fees of her son.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus lives at Alcala with her family. She earns income by selling grocery items to the people in her village. She offers friendly service; that is why she also gets regular customers who buy her merchandise. She wants to sell more goods but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy oil, vinegar, soap, sugar, canned goods and noodles to sell. This way, she will meet all her customers' demand for good products and services and acquire profits in return. She also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy oil, vinegar, soap, sugar, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as hopeful. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a market area. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap and other household goods. Her business goal is to have a bigger store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap and other household goods.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a forty-five-year-old hard-working married man with four children aged 9, 7, 5 and 2 years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in agriculture and grows sugar cane and bananas as his main source of income. He also carries out cattle rearing and earns a monthly salary. 

He started this business to educate his children. He faces a challenge of unpredictable weather changes. He has a vision of having a modernized farm and educating his children to university level.

Ben has asked for a loan to hire workers to clear the bush in his garden and plant more bananas.

loans.use: to hire workers to clear the bush in his garden and plant more bananas.

loans.name: Sitanisirasi

texts.en:
Sitanisirasi is a forty-year-old hard-working married man with three children aged 18, 16, and 6 years old, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income though he also carries out produce selling of maize and coffee to earn extra income. He started this business to have a better standard of living and educate his children. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations, however he has a vision of becoming a rich model farmer in his area. 

Sitanisirasi intends to use the loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material to make vitenge.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: María, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive con su hermana y sus hijos, reside en el municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara. María realiza su propia actividad de negocio, vende ropa para niñas. Ella siempre ha realizado esa actividad ayudándole a su madre. Además vende ropa de cama y lo hace de manera ambulante en la misma comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 6,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar más ropa de niña como vestidos, blusas, faldas para vender. Su plan es lograr tener un local propio para el negocio y seguir trabajando para darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, a single mother with two children, who lives with her sister and her children in the town of Macuelizo Santa Bárbara. María carries out her own business activity - selling girls' clothing. She has always done this, helping her mother. She also sells bed clothes and does so on the street in her community.

The loan she is applying for is her second loan cycle and is for 6,000 lempiras, with which she will buy more girls' clothing such as dresses, blouses and skirts to sell. Her plan is to have her own premises for the business and to continue working in order to give her children an education

loans.use: to buy girls' clothing such as dresses, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Fei

texts.en:
Fei is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling banana and taro chips in her community and has been doing this for 8 years. Fei has requested a loan to buy a new gas stove, deep fryer, bananas, taro, vegetable oil, containers etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fei will save for unexpected emergencies and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a new gas stove, deep fryer, bananas, taro, vegetable oil, containers etc.

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Omary is a man in his early twenties, who is married and has got a baby boy. Since young, he has been involved with car repair, a service he has been dreaming of. He is now managing a place for car repairs. He has also two compressors for car tubes, a business he has been in since 2006. He is still hoping to grow his business even more and make a great change to his surrounding community. For the sake of improving his business, he approached Tujijenge, a financial institution to find support. He is now among two member of Tupendane B group, who hold each accountable for any loan difficulties. 

Omary is requesting a third loan which he will use to buy a new compressor machine for his business. There is an increase in demand for compressor services in his center. He used the previous loans, he repaid back in full, to buy his current business machine (compressor). 

Because of his good work, Omary got extra income which he used to pay school fees and plow back to his business. He dreams of building up a big and modern garage.

loans.use: to buy a new compressor machine for his service.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora  María Guadalupe de 62 años  de edad es soltera  vive con una de sus sobrinas en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de baleadas y venta de ropa nueva, en su negocio ubicado en la comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña María Guadalupe es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, se levanta temprano todo los días a preparar las baleadas porque sus clientes le llegan temprano a comprar y provecha la mañana para hacer sus ventas, tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus productos son muy buenos y tiene buen precio y buena atención.
Doña María Guadalupe está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como harina, sal, soda, aceite, frijoles. Huevos, mantequilla, queso, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende, mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, es su sexto  préstamo que solicita.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora  María Guadalupe is 62 years old, single, and lives with one of her nieces in her house. She has been working selling baleadas (tortilla filled with fried beans) and new clothes in her business located in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras, for 10 years.

Doña María Guadalupe is a hardworking woman with a desire to move forward. She gets up early every day to make the baleadas because her customers arrive early to buy them and so she takes advantage of the morning to make her sales. She has a very good customer base as her products are very good and have a good price and quality.

Doña María Guadalupe is applying for this loan to buy raw material such as flour, salt, soda, oil, beans, eggs, butter, cheese, etc. With the support of this loan she hopes to improve her income and move forward. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma, this being her sixth loan cycle. Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, soda, oil, beans, eggs, butter, cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Asofolau

texts.en:
Asofolau is 50 years old and a single woman with 2 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for more than 4 years.

Asofolau has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, a wheel barrow and other things. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Asofolau will love to continue her business for the improvement of her family.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be hard-working. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are promising. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather and poor roads. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to repair his motorcycle and buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to grow big within five years.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 47 years old and blessed with two children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. She also engages in sewing pillow cases, bed sheets, and repairs clothes in her community to have an additional source of income. She aims to strengthen her business and make it profitable, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fabric, threads, hooks and eyes, and other materials needed in her tailoring shop. She is hoping that she will be granted her loan request so as to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, hooks and eyes and other materials needed in her tailoring shop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 31 years of age and single, has two children. Janet and her partner in life have not yet married due to financial inadequacy. She has been in chicken raising for almost three months and earns a net income of PHP 500 weekly. Her income from this business usually spent on the school allowances of her children. Due to insufficient funds she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase chickens and chicken feed. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more profitable and will improve.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ceann

texts.en:
Ceann, 29 years of age, is married to a government employee, and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost three years earning a net income of PHP 180 daily. 

Due to insufficient funds to run her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, beverages, rice grains, breads, and noodles to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, beverages, rice grains, breads, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, beans, maize flour, and wheat flour for her business . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, maize flour, and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a married man. He describes himself to be a fast thinker. He operates a retail business where he repairs motorcycles. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are transporters. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Jared will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials for repairing motorcycles. His business goal is to have a bigger repair business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be fruitful. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-eight-year-old hard-working married man with four dependents, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income and carries out produce-selling to earn extra income. He started this business to change the lives of his family members. He faces a challenge of drought and constant price fluctuations. Moses has a dream of buying more land to expand his farming project to get more profits.

Moses needs the loan to buy  fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has operated an agricultural farming business, selling farm produce from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She appreciates the support of the previous loan and she thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, and maize flour for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Agnes operates a motorcycle transport business to supplement her husband's income. She is 44 years old and has three children in school. She and her husband aimed to improve their status of living in order to educate their children give them a better living. To continuously use her motorcycle, she would like to avail a loan a mount of PHP 7,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Being a kind and industrious mother, she is hoping that she will increase her income and satisfy the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Tunu Group

texts.en:
Abdallah, a new client at Tujijenge, and who is joining the Tunu group, is aged in his early thirties. He is not married and runs a moving table business selling soft drinks and water, biscuits, sweets, cigarettes and so on. He use frozen ice blocks to make his drinks cold. Because he does not posses a business center, he shares a shift with his friend - he sells from 06pm through midnight to morning (08am). He works hard to improve his life. 

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use to replenish his business with take away sodas and water, biscuits, cigarettes etc. He dreams of becoming a successful businessman. He will share this loan with his loan group "Tunu" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his business with take away sodas and water, biscuits, cigarettes.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is aged 46, married and they're blessed with three children. He has owned and operated a motorcycle transport in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. His net income from this business is usually spent on the school fees of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds in his transportation business he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he will be able to improve his business even more.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Laima

texts.en:
Laima is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a market area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and cereals. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and her previous loans have been repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and cereals

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a twenty-five-year-old hard-working married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling maize, ground nuts and coffee as his main source of income alongside motorcycle (boda boda) transport where he earns additional income. He started this business to sustain his family. He faces a challenge of weather changes that affect his produce business since it is a seasonal kind of business and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands. He has a vision of expanding his business into new markets.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize, ground nuts and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, ground nuts and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Silivesiti

texts.en:
Silivesiti is a forty-two-year-old hard-working married man with four children aged 15, 10, 6, and 4 years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer who also buys and sells produce to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family. He faces a challenge of pests and diseases attacking his crops and soil exhaustion. He has a vision of transforming his business into commercial farming so that he can get more profits.

He intends to use the loan to rehabilitate his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 38 years old and married. She owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. Despite the hardship of living, she has the determination to improve the business and make it more profitable. 

Having inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of assorted biscuits, candies, shampoos, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her in making her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of assorted biscuits, candies, shampoos, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to purchase more goods for her kiosk shop.

Now, she would like to apply for a loan, to buy more stock of wheat flour, beans and rice for resale. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Savaliga

texts.en:
Savaliga is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Savaliga has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, plastic plates, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Savaliga will save for her children's education and use them to support her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, plastic plates, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 36-years-old, married and blessed with two children. They live in a rural community and earn their living through farming. Due to insufficient income, Daisy operates their motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. 

She and her husband plan to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. Her eldest son is now at the college level taking an engineering course. Due to the high cost of school fees, they can not afford to finance some of the necessities for school. For this reason, Daisy wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 20,000  to pay for the tuition fees, books and school uniform for her son. She hopes to use her requested amount to support the education of her son.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, books and school uniform for her son

loans.name: Eguransi

texts.en:
Eguransi is a 64-year-old single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop as her main source of income. She also practices agriculture as her side business. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself and plan for the future. High rental and license fees are a problem for her. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale.

She is requesting a loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Oliva, who is in her early 30s, is married and has  three children who are still in school. For two years now, she has been running a business selling wheat flour. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Oliva's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy sacks of maize and made a good quality and quantity of wheat flour. With this, she met most of her customers' demand. She paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought sofa sets, and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy maize seeds and to make wheat flour to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of buying big water tanks so she can start selling water.

Oliva will share this loan with her loan group Saranga, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and to make wheat flour to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Maria Christina

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Maria Christina has been engaged in selling Avon products within the local community to help her husband in gaining income. She is 37 years old and blessed with four children. Two of them are now at the college level. Maria Christina and her husband want them to become professionals and have a stable job someday. Due to the high cost of school fees, they cannot afford to finance all their schooling. In this regard, Maria Christina wants to take out a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fee and school uniform of her eldest daughter, who is studying for a bachelor of elementary education degree. She believes that this loan will be a great help for the education of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee and school uniform of her eldest daughter

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: To have an additional source of income, Pastora engages in sewing curtains, pillowcases and bed sheets that she sells in the local community. She is 52 years old and has three adult-age children. Due to financial hardship, she aims to continue and improve the business to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to take out a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy the needed fabric, thread, hook and eye closures and pin cushions. Through this loan, Pastora hopes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, hook and eye closures and pin cushions

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
This is Nzara. She previously accessed a loan that she used for constructing her house. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.  She still operates a food cafe.

She is requesting a loan to purchase food ingredients such as wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, onions, and tomatoes for her business.  She appreciates Kiva  for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, onions, and tomatoes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama KOEJU están en el 2do. ciclo con quince integrantes, ellas son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural que se encuentra en crecimiento, están en un lugar bastante alejado de la capital.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Celina quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadora tiene muchos clientes, y se siente agradecida por formar parte de la Fundación, y del programa de comité de mujeres. 
Celina pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás productos, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando y sacrificándose por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called KOEJU is in it's second loan cycle, with fifteen members. They are from the city of Santaní, a very rural area which is now growing, and is quite far from the capital.

One of the members is Celina who works selling food. She is very entrepreneurial and a hard worker and she has many customers. She feels thankful to be part of the foundation and part of the women's group program.
 
Celina is requesting a loan to be able to buy ingredients, such as greens, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables and other products, to continue making her food.  In this way she will be able to continue fighting and sacrificing in order to get ahead and help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables, and other ingredients in order to make food.

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her early fifties, is married with five children; only one is still at school. She has been supporting her family by running a low-cost food cooking business commonly known as a mamalishe. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit each month.

Pili is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She is looking for a loan to be apportioned among Pera, four group members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Pili will invest her portion to increase her food stock, to buy drinks and to buy charcoal for cooking. Her ambition is to build rooms for renting.

loans.use: to buy food stock, drinks, and charcoal

loans.name: Maria Nery

texts.es:
La señora  María Nery  de  47  años de edad  es  madre soltera y vive en su casa de habitación  con sus hijos, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y se dedica a la alfarería dese hace varios años.
Doña María Nery  elabora lo que son  jarros, joyeros, gallos de barro, plato, picheles y una gran variedad en adornos, es conocida  por ser una persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante, está muy contenta con el apoyo que se le ha brindado en otras ocasiones ya que ha tenido varios prestamos con Prisma. 
Doña María Nery  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de barro, pintura, piceles, etc. para seguir elaborando sus  adornos y jarrones,  con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar.
Su sueño es  terminar de construir su local.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Junio del 2014
texts.en:
María Nery is 47 years old and she is a single mother living in her home with her two children. Her business is located in her home, and she has worked with pottery for the last several years. María Nery creates jars, jewelry boxes, water jugs and a wide variety of ornaments. She is known as a person who works hard to get ahead. She is very happy with the support that she has been given; she has received several loans from Prisma.

María Nery is requesting this loan to purchase clay, paint and brushes to continue creating her ornaments and jugs. With the support of this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be able to continue supporting her family in her home. Her dream is to finish building her own small store.

loans.use: to purchase clay, paint and brushes for her business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Desde hace 9 años Julio emprendió su aventura de negocios atendiendo a su experiencia adquirida en su hogar paterno, cuya familia se dedicaba al comercio. Julio no siendo la excepción adelantó estudios superiores y con ellos técnicas, para el desarrollo de su empresa.  En su actividad de comerciante tiene una oferta de vestuarios, calzado etc. Sus mayores clientes los la encontrado en su familia y entre sus amigos quienes le han referido muchos mas, a los que debe responder de manera oportuna, pero tiene el desafío de lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente para atender a su demanda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, , mediante el cual comprará  vestuario, calzado y materiales de aseo. Sus ventas las hace a crédito y de contado todos los días de lunes a domingos con el fin de generar ventas que le representen nuevos ingresos y cumplir su sueño de tener su propia casa y educar con calidad a sus hijos
texts.en:
Nine years ago Julio undertook his business adventure by utilizing the experience that he got in his parents’ home.  His family devoted itself to commerce.  Not being the exception, Julio went forward with higher education and used those techniques to develop his business.  In his business activity as a merchant he sells clothes and shoes, etc.  Most of his customers are from his family and friends, and they have referred many more to him.  He needs to respond to them in a timely fashion.

However, he has the challenge of getting enough capital to take care of customer demand.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan.  It is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes, and cleaning materials.

He makes his sales for credit and for cash every day from Mondays through Sundays.  He does this to generate sales that serve as new income and to fulfill his dream of having his own house and giving his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: 34-year-old Francis is a single hardworking man with a retail shop in Hoima, Uganda. He also earns a monthly salary to supplement his income. He hopes to grow his business, despite competition hindering his business. He is accessing credit to buy more sugar, salt, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman who has been blessed with six school-going children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chizi operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ngani

texts.en:
Ngani is a married woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Ngani operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with five school-going children.

Kadzo has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Rin is a villager from Sangke district of Battambang province and she is 34 years old. She is a married mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one of whom is too young for schooling. To strive for a living, she grows rice and does paid work to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for 11 years and it earns 27,900 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, Rin is a seventh-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loans successfully and she is leading three members to get a new loan. Through the loan that she receives, Rin can upgrade her standard of living better than before and support her children's studies. 

Rin, as a leader, is seeking the loan with VisionFund in order to buy rice seeds and four sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing for her farmland. She hopes to expand her current business to a bigger scale than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and four sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Living in the remote area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Thy, who is 66 years old, is an experienced and industrious farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn a decent income to support only her family's daily expenses. She is a lovely mother of two married children.

Thy is living in a very old house and some parts need to be repaired. Therefore, she is borrowing some money from HKL to repair her house. In fact, Thy is an old client of HKL but this time she would like to get a Kiva loan since it has a low interest rate. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy tenaz que apoya económicamente a su esposo con la venta de pan dulce que realiza en el centro de su municipio de lunes a sábado y él trabaja elaborando estructuras metálicas en los cantones vecinos. Jesús desea ampliar su casa construyendo otro cuarto por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro y pagar mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesús is 40 years old and lives with her spouse and two children who are 14 and 6 years old.

She is a tenacious woman that helps her husband financially by selling sweet bread in the center of her town Monday through Saturday.  He works making metal structures in the neighboring areas. 

Jesús wishes to make her house larger by building another room. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron as well as to pay for labor for the construction of a room in her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron as well as to pay for labor for the construction of a room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh, a 62-year-old father of three married children, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he works as a farmer on a small rice field near his house. He has been involved in this career for almost 20 years so far, which allows him to make 5 USD per day.

Lonh would like to get his first loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Lonh thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.  She is 44-years-old and married with two children.  Hoa lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygenic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Jhone Joseph

texts.en: Jhone Joseph is 18-years-old and a freshman taking up Electrical Engineering. His father is a farmer while his mother manages a small store in their village selling grocery items. He wants to finish his education so he will become an engineer someday. From this, he will be a great help for his family. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for tuition fees and allowance. He promises to pay his loan in full.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowance

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hard-working mother who operates a motorcycle transport business to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband are determined to uplift their status of living. They work hand and hand-in-hand to attain their goals and make their dreams into reality. 

So that she can go on continuously using her motorcycle, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts and other accessories needed.

loans.name: Sefenia

texts.en:
Sefenia is a 42-year-old married man who supports a family of nine children. His wife adds additional income to the family. Sefenia has been operating a welding business which has been in operation for six years earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
  
Sefenia is now servicing his 2nd loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy welding equipment: a; Lincolin machine, protective gear or helmet, welding jacket, and boots which he requires for his working conditions. He plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase welding helmets, protective gear, jacket and boots.

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married with two children. After graduating from the tailoring department of a technical high school for girls, she began sewing for herself and her family. After getting married, she continued sewing outerwear for herself. Her friends and people in her circle really liked her sewing and starting putting in requests.  Zeynep first started sewing for her friends and then the work naturally turned into a business. She now works out of her house, sewing made-to-order outer garments.  

With the loan from Maya, she is going to buy herself another sewing machine. Because this machine is more multi-functional [than what she already has], she’ll be able to be able to sew more uniformly and she’ll have more business. Her biggest wish is to have greater financial security and to educate her children so they have careers.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Zeynep hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Kız meslek giyim bölümünden mezun olduktan sonra kendine ve ailesine dikişler dikiyor.  Evlenince de kendi üst giyimini dikmeye devam ediyor.  Arkadaşları ve çevresinde dikişleri çok beğeniliyor ve istek de bulunuyorlar.Z  eynep hanım ilk olarak arkadaşlarına dikmeye başlıyor ve bu iş kendiliğinden ticarete dönüşüyor.  Şimdi evinde sipariş üzerine dışarıya üst giyim dikişi yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile kendisine bir makine daha alacak.  Bu makina daha fonksiyonlu olduğundan dikişlerinin daha muntazam olacağını ve işini ilerteteceğini belirtti.  Ekonomik olarak güçlenmek,çocuklarını okutup meslek sahibi yapmak en büyük arzusu.

loans.use: to buy herself another sewing machine

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hard-working and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with six school-going children.

Mwaka sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan,Mwaka wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Chatra's Group

texts.en:
A citizen of Battambang province, Chatra is 33 years old. She has two children and they are still in school. For her household, rice farming has been the sole source of her income to support the family for nine years. The current business can earn her 36,100 KHR per day. 

This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she leads a group of four for the loan. The entire loan amount of her group is 4,400,000 KHR; 1,000,000 KHR is her portion of the loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion to pay for plowing and labor and to buy fertilizer and seeds. She strongly hopes that her standard of living will be better than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and labor and to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors, cement, sand, and paint in order to add the finishing touches to his home.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine, évolue dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis plus d’une vingtaine d’année. Il possède un champ qu’il cultive en permanence. Dans le cadre d’améliorer les conditions de travail, Lamine sollicite un crédit qui lui servira à l’acquisition d’un équipement agricole notamment d’un cheval qui va aider pour le travail manuel. Lamine commence sa journée à 7h et la fini à 19h, il adore et respecte son métier car il vit de cela avec sa famille et ses parents.
Grâce aux crédits, Lamine a pu diversifier aussi ses produits et services, payer la scolarité de ses enfants et mettre un peu d’argent de côté. 
Son projet futur est de faire de l’embouche ovine.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years. He owns a field that he farms full-time. As part of improving his working conditions, Lamine is seeking a loan that will allow him to purchase farming equipment, particularly a horse that will help with the manual labor. Lamine's day begins at 7:00am and ends at 7:00pm. He loves and has respect for his profession, because it's how he makes a living with his family and his parents.

Thanks to the[se] loans, Lamine has also been able to diversify his products and services, pay his children's school fees, and save a little money. His future project is to participate in sheep fattening.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment, particularly a horse to help in the fields.

loans.name: Coumba Yero's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mise en place le 27 Juin 2008 lors l’inauguration du  banc villageois. Il est composé femmes qui malgré enclavement du village ont su faire plus de 05 ans dans le programme et acquérir une solide expérience dans le système. Elles habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Coumba (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, mariée  et mère de sept enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de légumes, de poissons fumés, de pâte d’arachide et divers condiments qu’elle achète auprès de grands distributeurs pour la revente au détail  dans son village  et à l’occasion des marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter un panier de poissons fumés à 25 000 Fr CFA, et divers légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille d’une part et d’autre part à accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was established on the 27th of June 2008, when the "banc villageois" was inaugurated. It is composed of women who, despite the isolation of the village, have managed to be part of the program for five years and acquire a solid experience in the system. They all live in the same village and do small-scale commerce and rainy season agriculture. 

Madame Coumba (standing on the far right)  is the leader of the group. She is 49, married, and the mother of seven children. She sells vegetables, smoked fish, peanut butter, and various condiments that she buys from big distributors to resell in the village and at weekly markets in neighboring villages. 

Her new loan will allow her to buy a basket of smoked fish for 25,000 f CFA and various vegetables for resale. The profit will permit her to share in covering the needs of the family on the one hand, and grow her savings on the other.

loans.use: to buy a basket of smoked fish for 25,000 CFA and various vegetables, all for resale

loans.name: Nin

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Nin, 61, is an experienced and industrious farmer. She is a lovely mother of five married children and one adolescent. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 4 a day to support her family's daily expenditure. 

To accelerate her farming process, Nin would like to get cows to help her to plow the farm land, yet she can’t afford them. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy cows since it has a low interest rate. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Corn farming is the main source of income in Alcala. Ednalyn and her spouse are involved in this kind of business. They plant and harvest corn to sell. 

Ednalyn wanted to improve their crop production, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She will buy fertilizer and herbicides for use in farming. It will help ensure good nutrition to corn, so that, someday, her farm will produce a productive harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for use in farming.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 25 years old and married to Lilian. Together they have been blessed with two children who are four years and four months old. Lilian helps provide additional income for the family.

Moses is in the education sector and has been in it for the past four years, earning a monthly income of 35,000 KES. He has requested a second loan with VisionFund Kenya of 15,000 KES, which he will use to add additional stock of exam papers. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

Moses will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His future dream and hope is to open a large business through which he can educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to provide additional stock of exam papers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of metal boxes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty has a bar as well as a rental business in Hoima, Uganda. She works seven days a week. She saved money from farming and got initial capital for the bar business. She is a hard-working single lady with an aim of expanding herbusiness and stocking it to capacity to attract more customers and make more sales. She is challenged by low sales due to competition.

Betty is acquiring a loan to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
As the age of 54, Phally is working very hard on a small rice field behind her house in Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. With her husband, the daily profit for her house is USD 5 a day. So far, it is about thirty years that Phally has been a farmer.

Currently, Phally would like to request her first loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike for her children. Phally thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora  Martha de  44 años de edad es soltera, tiene  dos hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, vive en casa de un familiar  y se dedica desde hace 26 años al negocio de venta de tortillas.
Doña Martha  sus clientes le prefieren por su amabilidad y buen servicio y atiende a sus clientes desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, es una mujer trabajadora y muy sufrida y su deseo es sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio.
Doña Martha  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  leña, maíz, cal y mejorar un poco su taller.  Con el apoyo del préstamo espera seguir elaborando su producto y así obtener las ganancias necesarias para suplir sus gastos en el hogar. Para esta época en donde se vende bastante la tortilla, está muy contenta de seguir teniendo préstamo con Prisma es su sexto préstamo.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde ella vive es de un familiar.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old, and is single with two dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras, in a family member’s house. She has been making tortillas for a living for 26 years. Her customers choose her over other vendors because of her kindness and good service. She works from 6am until 7pm. She is a very hardworking woman who has gone through tough times, and whose dream is to have a successful business and family.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy firewood, corn, and lime, and to make small improvements in her work area. With the help of the loan, she hopes to further develop her product and obtain enough income to meet her household expenses. She has been selling a lot of tortillas recently, and is very happy to continue receiving Prisma loans (this is her sixth loan). Her dream is to have her own home, as she currently lives with a family member.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she cooks potato chips to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a safe location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes for preparing potato chips. Her business goal is to double business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 43 years old, married and has three children. Shirley and her spouse get income from the farming business they manage. 

Shirley is now requesting for additional capital of PHP 10,000 because she has insufficient funds to sustain her crops. She will utilize her loan well in order to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides) used in farming. She hopes this loan will be given to her so that crops will grow fruitfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides) used in farming.

loans.name: Wilder De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilder un trabajador hombre de 38 años de edad el cual se dedica a ejercer la profesión de electricista la cual aprendió hace 20 años empezando como ayudante de un amigo y solo en el año 2004 decidió independizarse y ofertar sus servicios en casas, fincas y su mayor ventaja es que nunca le dice no a un negocio por más lejano que le quede.
Padre de 2 hijos menores de edad se ha trazado metas y sueños que siempre los involucran a ellos dado que quiere brindarles todas las herramientas para que se conviertan en todos unos profesionales universitarios ejerciendo buenos cargos en una empresa. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales e insumos como son cables, imanes, cintas especiales las cuales necesita mucho en cada arreglo que realiza. 
Con este crédito lograra formar un buen capital de trabajo para invertir en su familia en su hogar y en el futuro de sus hijos
texts.en:
Wilder is a 38 year old working man who makes a living as an electrician. He learned this trade 20 years ago, beginning as his friend’s assistant. It was only in 2004 that he decided to become independent, offering his services in homes and farms. His biggest advantage is that he never turns down a job due to distance.

He is the father of two young children, and has set goals and dreams to always support them, as he wants to provide them with all the tools necessary to become university-educated professionals with good corporate jobs.

He is requesting a loan to buy materials and supplies such as cables, magnets, and special tapes that he constantly needs for his repairs. With this loan he will be able to achieve working capital to invest in his family, his home, and in his children’s future.

loans.use: buy materials and supplies such as cables, magnets, and special tapes that he constantly needs for his electrical repair business.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a forty-three-year-old hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is livestock production whereby he does cattle fattening, goat rearing alongside selling produce such as ground nuts, maize and coffee.
