He started this business to increase his income inflow and look after his family. He has hardships of competition and quarantine imposed on cows due to the foot and mouth disease.

Vicent is requesting a loan to buy more cows to fattening on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten on his farm.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es una persona de 30 años de edad, Unido, quien vive en el departamento de Sololá. El esta solicitado otro préstamo en ADICLA, por la época que es apta para la siembra de hortalizas. Al inicio fue difícil que alguien le prestara capital de trabajo para iniciar con sus actividades productivas, prestaba con los familiares pero costaba mucho. Ahora con el préstamo que la asociación le otorgo ha logrado mantener y mejorar la cosecha además a ayudado a la compra de alimentos para su familia mejorando sus condiciones de vida. El está solicitando otro préstamo de Q 7000.00 para la compra de insumos agrícola, principalmente semillas y abono para el cultivo de papa. La meta que tiene es poder tener su vivienda propia ya que actualmente vive con sus padres
texts.en: Pedro is a 30 year old person who lives with his partner in the Department of Solola. He's requesting another loan from ADICLA because it's the right time to plant vegetables. At first it was difficult to get working capital to start his agricultural activities. He managed to get loans with family but it was very tough. Now with the loan granted by the association he has successfully maintained and improved the harvest, and also has helped buy food for his family and improve their quality of life. He's requesting another loan in the amount of Q 7000.00 to purchase agricultural supplies, mainly seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes. The goal is to have a home of his own since he currently lives with his parents.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizers to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Leang is working very hard on a small rice field behind her house in Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. With her husband, the daily profit for her household is USD 4 a day. So far, Leang has been a farmer for about 30 years.

Currently, Leang would like to request her first loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike for her children. Leang thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild the greenhouses for the new season.

loans.name: Damari

texts.en:
Damari is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a marketable location and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sweets, drinks and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sweets, drinks and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nidia Emilse

texts.es:
Nidia una luchadora, trabajadora y muy echada para adelante mujer que a pesar de enfrentar un fuerte problema pues se separó de su esposo y este la dejo a la deriva sin recursos para comer no se dejó vencer de esta adversidad y gracias a sus habilidades culinarias logro montar una microempresa donde oferta productos como snacks y comidas típicas colombianas. 
Por más ganas de salir adelante que tenga nidia se enfrenta a un gran problema y es que no tiene muchos recursos económicos disponibles por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus deliciosos platos pues de esta actividad depende Nidia no solo para comer si no para pagar unos servicios y cosas que se le presenten
texts.en: Nidia is a fighter, a hardworking progressive woman who didn't give in to adversity in spite of the severe problem created by the separation from her husband in which he left her without the means to eat. Thanks to her culinary talents she managed to set up a small business where she sells items such as snacks and traditional Colombian dishes. But no matter how great her desire to get ahead Nidia faces a problem, namely that she doesn't have much in the way of financial resources at her disposal. That's why she's requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make her delicious dishes, since Nidia depends on this business not just to eat but also to pay for services and items that come up.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making meals, such as meat, vegetables, and fruit

loans.name: Jovanny Arleider

texts.es:
Jovanny es un agricultor de 34 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo al lado de sus tíos y padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de zanahoria y habichuela, cultivos que asiste todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio.
Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 
Jovanny, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jovanny is a 34 year-old hardworking and humble farmer, who learned how to work the fields as a child alongside his parents and uncles. This has allowed him to progress, and today he has carrot and bean crops, which he attends to daily. The crops are then sold in the town market.

With the loan he will buy agricultural supplies in bulk (fertilizers, pesticides, manure, etc.), with which he will continue tending his crops to produce a better, more productive harvest, which will increase his revenue when selling the products.

Jovanny, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, wants to keep fighting to fulfill his dream of owning his own farm, where he will grow a bigger variety of products and improve the profitability of his business, ensuring economic stability and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. Siempre  se ha dedicado a la agricultura junto a su familia, lleva 14 años de cultivar café el cual vende a los intermediarios de la zona. El préstamo que esta solicitando es el segundo ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlo a su finca y siembra de más plantas de café. Su meta es mejorar la cosecha y comprar otra parcela de tierra para cultivar y ampliar la finca de café.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in a neighborhood in the town of Flores, Lempira.

Maria has always worked in agriculture alongside her family. She has been growing coffee for 14 years and sells her product to brokers in the area. The loan she is requesting is her second one and is in the amount of 20,000 HNL. She will use the money to buy fertilizers that she will apply on her farm for planting more coffee seedlings.

Her goals are to improve her harvest and to buy another parcel of land for cultivation so that she can expand her coffee farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to plant more coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cutlery such as plates and spoons and add more types of vegetables.

loans.name: Thiết

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiết works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thiết has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Thiết is 54 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives with no dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thiết’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thiết faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and well.

With her business profit, Thiết hopes for her children to find good jobs and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 19-year-old single man from Attell, a village near Tulkarm.  He works with his brothers on the family land where they plant it with seasonal crops.  They use greenhouses to insure they have good quality. Amer would like to improve the family business and expand it in the future. Amer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild the greenhouses for the new season. By taking this loan, Amer will be able to improve the land and increase its productivity.  

Amer appears in the photo on the family land.

loans.use: to rebuild greenhouses for the new season.

loans.name: Marvin Geovanny

texts.es:
El señor  Marvin de 33 años de edad es padre de dos niños, tiene casa propia y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose por más de 5 años al negocio de comercio de sal y molino.
Don Marvin es una persona muy trabajadora con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de sal, porque lo necesita para comprar de producto ya que tiene bastante demanda de la sal, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante y obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Marvin su sueño es darle una buena educación a su hija y que su negocio crezca.

San Lorenzo, Honduras –  Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 33 year old father of two children, has a home of his own, and lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For over 5 years he has worked in the salt milling business. Marvin is a very hardworking person who wants to get his family ahead, and he's requesting the loan to purchase salt since he needs to buy product because of the high demand for salt. He hopes that this investment will enable him to get ahead and obtain the income necessary to improve his quality of life. Marvin's dream is to provide a good education to his daughter and grow his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-June 2014.

loans.use: To purchase salt for his business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 48-year-old mother who engages in selling some grocery items within her village to earn additional income. Due to financial difficulty, she  aims to make her business profitable in order to sustain the necessities of her family and save some for their future. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy more stocks of canned goods, laundry soap, noodles, beverages, seasonings, and snack foods to resell. She is hoping that she will receive her loan request to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, laundry soap, noodles, beverages, seasonings, and snack foods to resell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga, age 33, is not yet married to a tricycle driver and they have two children. She has sold fish for a living for almost one year, and earns a net income of PHP 600 a week. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to use a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase milk fish to sell in their village. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase milk fish to sell in their village.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café en esta nueva temporada

loans.name: Melendrina

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Melendrina has been engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within her community. She is 45-years-old and has three schooling children. She and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to sustain their necessities and support the education of their children. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Melendrina wants to improve her business to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to  buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell. Being a kind and diligent mother, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to  buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is 26 years old. She is married to Fredrick and together they have been blessed with two children, who are eight years and four years old respectively. Fredrick is employed and hence provides additional income for his family.

Maurine sells clothing. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings). She has requested her third loan with VisionFund Kenya of 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy stocks of clothes for resale. Maurine successfully paid back her previous loans.

Maurine will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and expand her business further. Her dreams and hopes are to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga Marina de 39  años de edad, es casada,  tiene cuatro   hijos  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Olga tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 01 año y medio a la elaboración  de tortilla,  se levanta temprano todo los días a moler el maíz para vender las tortillas a los clientes ya que tiene una buena clientela.
Doña Olga está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra materia prima como lo es el maíz, leña y cal para poder seguir elaborando sus tortillas y obtener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a sus familia.
Doña Olga espera poder comprar estos productos porque está un poco barato ahorita y quiere aprovechar. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda para este año y seguir trabajando.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Olga Marina is 39 years old, married, and has four children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. Olga Marina has her own house, and has worked making tortillas for one year. She wakes up early every day to grind the corn to sell the tortillas, which has provided her with many good customers. 

Olga Marina is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials such as corn, firewood, and lime, to continue making her tortillas and obtain enough income to support her family. Olga hopes to buy these products because they're a little less expensive right now, and she wants to take advantage. Her dream is to improve her home this year and to continue working. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Olesya

texts.ru:
Олеся живет в Берегово. Она предоставляет маникюрные услуги. Занимается бизнесом 9 лет. Помещение для работы арендует. У Олеси есть 13-летняя дочка, которую она сама воспитывает, так как с мужем она в разводе. Олесе было тяжело встать на ноги после развода, так как пришлось за все нести ответственность самой, да и алиментов у отца девочки она не просила. 
 Полученную от КИВА сумму в 40 000 гривен Олеся планирует вложить в развитие новой сферы бизнеса, который, на ее взгляд, поможет создать для семьи более постоянное обеспечение. Она хочет открыть магазин для торговли женской одеждой, и деньги нужны на закупку товара. Олеся считает, что стабильный доход из разных источников поможет ей обезопасить свою семью и обеспечить их с дочерью всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Olesya lives in Beregovo. She provides a manicure service. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. She leases her work space. Olesya has a 13-year-old daughter, whom she is raising on her own because she is divorced from her husband. It was difficult for Olesya to get back on her feet after the divorce because she had to carry all of the responsibilities by herself and never asked for support from her daughter's father.

Olesya plans to invest the 40 000 hryvnia loan obtained from Kiva into developing a new business area that, in her opinion, would help create a more sustainable income for the family. She wants to open a store to sell women's clothing and needs money to buy the merchandise. Olesya thinks that a stable income from different sources would help her to safeguard her family and provide her and her daughter with all of the necessities.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a new clothing store

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh works in agriculture, farming food. Minh has been involved in this business for three years.

Minh is 38 years old, and she is married with two children. She supports two dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Minh’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Minh faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Minh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children. He has been running an automotive spare parts shop for twelve years, earning himself 8,000 KES every month. His wife, Emilly, also works to support the family.

Alfred was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing his first loan of 15,000 KES. He will use this to buy brake pads and discs, body panels, spark plugs, tires and shock absorbers, which are running out of stock in his shop.

The profits Alfred earns will be used to expand his wife’s green grocery business and educate his children. He is striving to be a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy more car parts to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, aged 26, is married to a tricycle driver, and they're blessed with one child. She has managed a hog raising business for five months. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es: Maria, tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio, vende almohadas, cojines, forros de muebles y cortinas. Ella compra y vende los productos y los revende en su casa o por pedidos. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para mantener esta actividad, con el actual son 9 ciclos. El préstamo es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar mas almohadas, cameras, forros y cortinas para vender y poder aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Su plan es ampliar el negocio y mejorar el nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 34, is single and lives with her mother in a community in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has been earning a living through retail since since she was very young. She sells pillows, cushions, sofa covers, and curtains. She buys the products and then sells them in her home, or takes orders. 

Maria has received several loans to help with her business, and this is her 9th loan cycle. With the loan of 15 000 lempiras, she will buy more pillows, bed linens, sofa covers, and curtains to sell and thus be able to increase her sales and profits. Her plan is to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pillows, bed linens, sofa covers, and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, gravel, and cement and to pay for the labor to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, a 27-year-old father of one little child who is enrolling in the local primary school, lives in a rural area of Svay Chek District, Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he works as a farmer on a small rice field near his house. Up until now, it has been almost seven years that he has been involved in this career, which allows him to make $3 USD per day.

Ra would like to get his first loan from HKL (Hattha Kaksekar Limited) that is for him to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Ra thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a barber and a married man who has two children. His barber shop is located in the city.

This is Francis’s first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use his 10,000 KES loan to buy hair-cutting equipment. He wants to be successful and have a bigger barber shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy hair-cutting equipment

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira de 69 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como sastre, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, tiene su puesto en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 47 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Edelmira está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de calzado por mayor y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Edelmira is sixty-nine years old and lives in her own home with her husband, who works as a tailor.  She makes a living selling shoes and has had a stall in the market near her home for the past forty-seven years.  With what she earns from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they manage to cover some of the necessities that arise in their home.  

Edelmira is requesting a loan to buy shoes on a wholesale basis to be able to obtain better earnings and have a better quality of life together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina manages a boarding house business in front of the university school. While waiting for her boarders’ monthly payment, she also runs a barbeque business. She prepares the food early in the afternoon so that she can start to sell at 3 o’clock in the afternoon until 8 o’clock in the evening. Marcelina sells grilled hot dogs, meat, chicken intestines, and liver. 

Marcelina wishes to earn a higher income because she wants to expand her boarding house. Because of this, Marcelina is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy more meats and other raw ingredients for her barbeque business. She hopes to obtain her desired loan to grow the business and will expand her boarding house soon.

loans.use: to buy more meats and other raw ingredients for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Lütfiye

texts.en:
Lütfiye runs a home-cooking restaurant. She makes the food herself, and is very particular about the food she serves. She says that her customers have grown used to how she makes her food, and thus does not leave the cooking to her employees. 

Lütfiye is a retired teacher at a school for economically deprived children. When she separated from her husband at a young age, she became entirely responsible for her daughters. When her salary was not enough to meet the demands of raising her children, she began to take extra work. At first, she became a maid and at the same time began to make and sell jewelry and knitting. For a long time, she has sold her jewelry and knitting on an “artists’ street” by the coast. 

When she retired, she opened a fast food restaurant and continued selling her wares on the side. Later, she passed on the fast food restaurant to her daughter and opened the home-cooking restaurant she now runs. She emphasizes that she has struggled her entire life and that nothing has come easy to her. With the loan, she will buy kitchen supplies.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Lütfiye hanım  ev yemekleri lokantasını işletiyor.  Yemeklerini kendisi yapıyor.  Bu konuda çok titiz davranıyor .  Müşterilerim benim elimi lezzetine alıştığını ve bu lezzeti aradıklarından elemanına yemek işini bırakmıyor.  Lütfiye hanım bir kurumdan öğretmen olarak emekli oluyor.  Fakat genç yaşta eşinden ayrılınca iki kzının tüm sorumluluğu kendisine kalıyor.  Hayat şartlarının zorluğundan maaş üç çocuğu yetiştirmeye yetmeyince ek işler yapmaya başlıyor.  İlk önceleri ev temizliklerine gidiyor ve aynı zamanda el işi örgüler ,çeşitli takılar yapıp satmaya başlıyor.  Bir süre yaptığı takıları ve el işlerini sahilde ki sanat sokağında satıyor.  Emekli olunca bir fast food dükkanı açıyor burada da boş zamanların da el işi yapıp satıyor.  Bu dükkanı daha sonra kızına bırakıyor ve kendisi şu an işlettiği ev yemekleri dükkanını açıyor.  Hayatının hep mücadele ile geçtiğini hiçbir şeyin kendisi için kolay olmadığını hep zorluklarla mücadele edip bu duruma geldiğini vurguluyor.  Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına mutfak malzemeleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for training in heavy machinery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools and motorcycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es: Este es el Nuevo Grupo “Génesis” y está conformada por 06 socios optimistas dispuestos a comenzar a trabajar. Anita de 39 años es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de queso. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Anita ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. El deseo de Anita es seguir prosperando en su negocio. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de queso y de esta manera dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El nuevo grupo “Génesis” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Anita se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo con rayas morado y blanco.
texts.en:
This is the new group, Génesis.  It is comprised of six optimistic members who are ready to start working.  Anita, age 39, is separated and has one dependent child.  She buys and sells cheese.  It is with much effort and dedication that Anita has managed to get ahead in her business.  Anita wishes to continue prospering in her business.

That is why she requested the loan to buy cheese.  This way she will give her customers better service.

The new group, Génesis, is grateful to those people who made this loan possible.

Anita is standing in the back.  She is the first one on the left, and she is wearing a top with purple and white stripes.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Líderes De Santa Rosa” grupo responsable conformada por 15 socios activos y responsables, que cada día buscan mejorar. Este es el caso de Zoraida de 55 años separada con 02 hijos aún dependientes. Zoraida lleva más de 04 años dedicándose a la venta de productos naturales. Su mayor deseo de Zoraida es contar con un puesto de venta donde puede exhibir más  productos. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de tónicos, vitaminas y jarabes.  Gracias a su esfuerzo su negocio le va bien. El grupo “Líderes De Santa Rosa” agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible dicho crédito. Zoraida se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chompa rosado.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Líderes De Santa Rosa” [Leaders of Santa Rosa] is a responsible group made of 15 active and responsible members, that looks to improve every day. 

This is the case of Zoraida who is 55 years old and separated with 2 children who are still dependent. Zoraida has more than 4 years earning a living selling natural products. Zoraida's greatest desire is to have a place to sell where she can exhibit more products. With the goal of continuing to improve she requested a loan to buy medicines, vitamins, and syrups. Thanks to her efforts her business is doing well.  

The group “Líderes De Santa Rosa” thanks all of the Kiva investors for making said loan possible. Zoraida is pictured seated, the second from the right and is wearing a pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamins and syrups.

loans.name: Melvis Sulema

texts.es:
La señora Melvis 34 años de edad es madre de 02 hijos que depende de ella, vive  en la comunidad del sur de Honduras, en casa de propia  y se dedica desde hace 04  años  a la venta de abarrotería.
Doña Melvis sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario llegan a su casa es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 
Doña Melvis está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como ser jabón, pollo, frescos, churros, pastas, azúcar, harina, frijoles, queso, café, etc. con el apoyo del crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Melvis is 34 years old and the mother of two children who depend on her. She lives in her own home in a community in southern Honduras. She has been selling groceries for four years. Melvis's customers are her friends and other people who come to her house every day. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead. 

Melvis is requesting this loan to buy goods for her store, such as soap, chicken, drinks, pastries, pastas, sugar, flour, beans, cheese, coffee, etc. She hopes to increase her income and business with the loan. Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014.

loans.use: to buy soap, chicken, drinks, pastries, pastas, sugar, flour, beans, cheese, coffee, etc for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and married to Andrew. Together they have been blessed with two children now aged thirty and 25 years.

For the past ten years Mary has sold fish, earning a monthly income of approximately 1,500 KES. She took out and successfully repaid a prior loan through VisionFund Kenya. She is now applying for a 5,000 KES loan to buy additional fish for resale.

With the anticipated profits Mary will be able to help support her family. Her hopes and dreams are to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for resale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet, 27 years old, is married and has three children. The family lives in Kasese, Uganda.

To supplement her family’s income, Harriet sells a variety of groceries and produce. She faces a lot of competition, yet she is determined to see her business grow. She is applying for a 400,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy carrots, cabbages, Irish potatoes and tomatoes to sell.

Harriet’s dream is to see her children educated.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей, старший сын живет и работает в России, младшие проживают с Жамилой и ее мужем. У Жамилы - среднее образование, ни она, ни ее муж не работают официально, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому с 2004 года, Жамила занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жамилы есть 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 15 овец и 1 лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,00 ГА собственной и 1,00 ГА арендованной земли, где Жамила и ее муж выращивают картофель и эспарцет. Также супруг Жамилы занимается заготовкой и продажей дров в местные пекарни. Дрова он пилит вручную в  ущелье, складывает в мешки, затем везет их на гужевой повозке за много километров до деревни. Также Жамила реализует молоко местным жителям. Семья с радостью берется за любую работу, а дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Однако, ежемесячный доход составляет всего лишь 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья и в первую очередь для покупки коровы для увеличения объемов получаемого молока. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и дать достойное образование детям. Также Жамила хочет построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Zhamila is 49 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. The oldest son lives and works in Russia, and the younger children live with Zhamila and her husband. Zhamila has a secondary education and neither she nor husband are officially employed because it is very difficult to find work in the village, but it is necessary to support the family and raise the children. This is why Zhamila has been involved in agriculture since 2004. Today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 bull, 15 sheep and 1 horse. She also has a 1.00 hectare owned land and 1.00 hectare of leased land, where Zhamila and her husband grow potatoes and sainfoin. Zhamila's husband is also involved in preparing and selling firewood to local bakeries. He cuts the wood manually in canyon, places it in bags and then drives them by horse for many kilometers to the village. Zhamila also sells milk to local residents. However, the monthly income amounts to only 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zhamila requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock in order to increase livestock headcount and to first buy a cow to increase obtained milk volumes. Zhamila plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities and provision of decent education for her children. Zhamila also wants to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron as well as to pay for labor to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия заботливая мать и жена. Она живет вместе со своей семьей в доме, который достался им от родителей ее мужа. Робия очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она 9 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей ткани и парфюмерий. Робия торгует в универмаге. Она имеет регулярных покупателей, так как периодически обновляет ассортимент своего товара. Робия с бизнесом справляется сама. Она данное время нуждается в финансовой поддержке, так как она собирается купить новые виды тканей и парфюмерия для расширения ассортимента. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Robiya is caring mother and wife. She lives with her family in a house that was left to them by her husband's parents. Robiya is a very hardworking woman. She started her business in reselling fabrics and perfumes 9 years ago. Robiya sells at a department store. She has regular customers because she periodically updates her merchandise selection. Robiya runs this business by herself. At the present time, she needs financial assistance because she is planning to purchase new types of fabrics and perfumes in order to expand her selection. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics and perfumes in order to expand her selection

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 44 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Her children are in high school and college. In order to provide for her children's needs, Lilia has a retailing business, while her husband operates their van for passengers’ transportation. Lilia wanted to earn more income from her sari-sari store (general store). In order to do this, she needs to extend the products she is selling to her customers in their village. Lilia is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy drinks, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, powdered milk, coffee, and sugar. Lilia hopes to increase her income in order to continue sending her children to school and college.

loans.use: to buy drinks, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, powdered milk, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a married man with one child. For the past two years he has earned a living transporting customers using his motorcycle. His business is located in a good area with customers from the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital.

Eddy is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP Microfinance Bank, which he will use to buy a tuk tuk, a three-wheeled motor vehicle, for a more lucrative method of transport. He will use the anticipated profits to promote his business.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk

loans.name: Mariama Sadio

texts.fr:
Mariama est l’une des femmes fondatrices du groupement. Elle est mariée et mère de  04 enfants dont 03 garçons de 09 à 15 ans et une fille de 04 ans. C’est une femme très exemplaire dans ce groupe et y joue un rôle très important dans son stabilité et son développement. Elle gère une boutique dans le village où elle vend divers produits de consommation courante en passant du riz au bonbon pour enfants. Elle a une très grande expérience dans ce domaine du fait qu’elle la pratiquait même avant la naissance du banc villageois.

Avec son nouveau prêt ; elle prévoit d'acheter du riz 10 sacs (12500/u), 04 bidons huile de 20 litres à 17 500/u de l'oignon importer 8 sacs à 11 500/u, de la farine du jumbo... pour une valeur de 200 000f.

Avec un bénéfice net par semaine en moyenne de 12 500, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille et faire grandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Mariama is one of the founders of the group. She is married and the mother of four children, three sons aged from 9 to 15 years old and a daughter aged four years old.  Mariama is an exemplary member of this group and plays an important role in its stability and its development. She runs a shop in the village where she sells various frequently consumed foodstuffs ranging from rice to candy for children. She has a lot of experience in this field since she has been in this business since before the "banc villageois" came into being. 

With her new loan she expects to buy 10 sacks of rice at 12,500 each, four jerrycans of 20 liters of oil at 17,500 each, eight sacks of  imported onions at 11,500 each, and flour from Jumbo for a total value of 200,000 f. With her net profit per week averaging 12,500, she intends to help her husband cover the household expenses and also to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice at 12,500 each, four jerrycans of 20 liters of oil at 17,500 each, eight sacks of  imported onions at 11,500 each, and flour from Jumbo for a total value of 200,000 f.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 39-year-old married lady with four children living in Fort Uganda. She runs a restaurant, the business she started with a vision of earning a living. She  faces challenges of food price fluctuation. Besides that, she hopes to have enough cash for her family and to expand her business to new areas. Joyce needs a loan to finish constructing her house.

loans.use: to finish constructing her house.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a farmer from Amberd, a village in the region of Armavir. She lives there with her husband and two teenage children, a son and a daughter.

Anna and her husband have a farm. She cultivates greens and cucumbers and has various types of fruit trees, including apples, pears, peaches, plums and cherries. The family also keeps pigs. Her husband and she are now planning to expand their farm a bit by making some investments.

Anna has applied for a loan of 2500 USD to pay for three kilograms of cucumber seed, fifteen bags of fertilizer, twenty liters of pesticides and 200 bags of animal feed. As this is Anna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to loan products until now because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticides and animal feed for her farm.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally and her family live in Peñablanca. She is an 18 year old student and is taking up a Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy. She chose this course because laboratory and sciences is her passion. Her parents are very supportive of her dreams but sometimes their income is not sufficient to support all her needs at school. Now Sally is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay tuition fees and allowances. This loan will help her pay tuition fees on time and pursue her education. Sally will be a great help to her family if she becomes a successful pharmacist someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and allowances.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 20-years-old, a fifth year Civil Engineering student. Gladys' parents' sources of income are farming and a vegetable vending business. They plant and sell corn and vegetables to sell. Gladys is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay tuition fees and allowance at school. Gladys hopes to finish her education and someday help her parents lift their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and allowance at school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, idlers, and connector pins to change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fish and frozen foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Sokhna Fall's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de 02 femmes qui habitent le même village; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Magatte l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaire et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 03 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter  01 sac de sucre à 23000F, un sac de lait, 10000F de condiment (piment, poivre, ail) et le reste de son argent elle va le donner à sa sœur pour achat de tissu et de parfum. l'activité marche petit à petit car il y a d'autres qui font la même activité. Avec ses bénéfices elle va subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: This group is composed of two women living in the same village. Their main business activity is retail. Magatte, a star borrower, is the group's leader. She is 36 years od, married and the mother of two. She is the one standing on the left in the photo. She retails food products and has work experience of over three years. With her loan she plans to buy a bag of sugar for 23,000 West African francs, a bag of []owdered] milk, 10,000 francs' worth of condiments (pimento, pepper, garlic etc); she will give the rest of the money to her sister to buy fabric and perfume. The business is growing slowly as there are many competitors. She will use the money to cover her person expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products [for resale].

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 39-year-old married, hardworking woman who supports a family of three children.  Her husband adds additional income for their family.  Janet operates a charcoal sales stall which has been in operation for four years, earning her an income of KES.10,000 at the end of every month.

Janet is now servicing her second loan of KES. 25,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends use the entire amount of money to add more stock of charcoal which she is presently short of.

Janet plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a wholesaler of charcoal in her community.

loans.use: To add additional stock of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
To make a living, Fe runs a farming business. She and her husband grow rice in their field. They have three children and one is in college now. Since their income from the farming business is seasonal only in the harvesting period, Fe finds an alternate source of income to be able to cover their children's daily allowances for school. Fe works as laborer in someone else's field while her husband is a swing arm maker. 

 Fe wants to borrow a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pay for labor costs for her farming business. Fe hopes to maintain the business, harvest a good yield, and further support her child's needs in finishing the college level of education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells utensils and basins. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to have branches in different towns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to sustain her family with the income generated from her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 24 years old, has two children, and lives in Kagadi, Uganda where he has been selling produce to earn a living since 2008, especially beans. He supplements his income with earnings from a motorcycle transport business and farming. His businesses are challenged by price fluctuation but through his hard work and earnings, he hopes to grow his business. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Señor De La Misericordia De Surco Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DE LA MISERICORDIA DE SURCO” está conformado por socios entusiastas dedicados a la agricultura y ganadería. Buenaventura tiene 58 años de edad soltera dedicada al cultivo de frutas flores para luego expenderlos al por mayor y menor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar su cultivo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Buenaventura es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste casaca de color acero.
texts.en: The group “Señor de la misericordia de Surco” comprises nine enthusiastic members who work in agriculture and livestock. Buenaventura is 58 years old, single, and makes a living cultivating fruit and flowers to sell wholesale and retail. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers to improve her crop. The group is grateful for the loan made available by Kiva lenders. Buenaventura is the second person standing on the right side, wearing a steel blue colored jacket.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mamura

texts.ru: Мамура родилась в 1985 году. Она замужем. Мамура в этом году родила сына. Ему 7 месяцев. Однако ее младенец болен. Мамура отвезла его к врачу и данное время врачи лечат его. Мамура должна купить необходимые лекарства для лечения сына, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как помидор, лук и т.п. Она очень нуждается финансовой поддержке. Мамура запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения сына. Она ждет и нуждается вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Mamura was born in 1985. She is married. Mamura gave birth to a son this year. He is now 7 months old. Unfortunately, her baby is ill. Mamura took him to a doctor, and he is currently under doctors' care. Mamura has to purchase necessary medicine for her son's treatment, but does not have enough money. She is involved in growing agricultural crops, such as tomatoes and onions. She really needs financial support. Mamura is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase medicine to treat her son. She awaits and needs your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine to treat her son

loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en: Norielyn is 18 years old and is taking up Hotel and Restaurant Services. She wants to finish college to rise above poverty with her family. Because her family is struggling financially, she wants to access a loan of P10,000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that the lenders will approve this loan for it will definitely help her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun is 60 years old and a mother of ten children; currently, one of them is in school. She is a farmer who grows rice on nine hectares of farmland as the main source of income to feed the family. This business has earned her a decent income and she has been involved in it for 32 years. This is not her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to uplift her living condition. 

For this cycle, she is a leader of four to get the new loan. She and her group members are requesting the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. Yun is planning to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, gasoline and to pay for labor. She really hopes to improve her living conditions at a better pace than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, gasoline and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie is a responsible housewife who operates a motorcycle transport business to earn additional income. She and her husband dream of becoming successful in the future. With this regard, they are striving hard to earn and save income to sustain the necessities of their family. To continuously operate her motorcycle, Ronie wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Through this loan Ronie believes that she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, rice, sugar, and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, rice, sugar, and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора  является мастером своего дела.  Она занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Гулнора продает женские и мужские обуви на местном рынке. Ей  41 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 10 лет назад она начала свой бизнес. Она имеет торговую точку на местном рынке.  Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Гулнора хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес дальше. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки обуви для расширения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora is an expert in her business. She is involved in her own small business. Gulnora sells women's and men's shoes at a local market. She is 41 years old. She is married and raising two children. She started this business 10 years ago in order to provide her family with all of the necessities. She has a retail outlet at a local market. Her husband helps her with running the business. Gulnora wants to increase her working capital and, thus, develop her business further. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy shoes in order to increase her working capital. She relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy shoes in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Buenos Aire Group

texts.es: Alicia: Es una mujer amable,  coordinadora del grupo solidario, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene  40 años de edad, casada, tiene 3  hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo es agricultor. Algunos productos lo provee de su finca para la pulpería de su esposa: plátanos, leña y carbón. Con el propósito de contar con su propio ingreso, desde hace 10 años vende comida en el mercado.  Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos: Harina, azúcar, arroz, carne, café instantáneos, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y apoyar en el desarrollo humano y profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alicia: She is a friendly woman and a coordinator of a solidarity group. She is originally from Puerto Cabezas and is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer. He provides some products from his farm to his wife's general store: bananas, firewood, and charcoal.

In order to have her own income, she has sold food at the market for 10 years. She is asking for her first loan to buy supplies: flour, sugar, corn, beef, and instant coffee, among other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and to support the human and professional development of her kids.

loans.use: to buy supplies: flour, sugar, corn, beef, and instant coffee, among other products.

loans.name: Charlbeth

texts.en: Charlbeth is studying Hotel and Restaurant Services. She is already in her second year. She is determined to finish college to rise above poverty and to help her parents. Because they are struggling financially, she wants to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders by availing a 10,000 PHP loan.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old. She is married to John and together they have been blessed with two children; one who is 12 years old and adopted, and their biological child of five years.

Mary sells poultry, a business she has done for the last three years. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 which she will use to purchase breeders and chicken feed. This will be her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Mary will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her future dream and hope is to become a major supplier of fresh chicken and eggs.

loans.use: to purchase breeders and chicken feed.

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es:
Don pablo es de la comunidad sasama tiene 46 años de edad  esta casado  de ese matrimonio procreo  3 hijas todas ya están grandes, la menor de sus hijas va a la escuela de la comunidad el quiere que ellas se preparen y por lo menos aprendan lo básico pues la comunidad y la situación económica que tienen no les permite para darles tanto
el se dedica a labores de siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas de esta manera el con esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia ,en la comunidad no tienen energía eléctrica y dice que por las noches  y madrugada  tienen que usar candelas phocos o candiles para poder iluminarse , comenta que es realmente una necesidad tener luz en la vivienda ya que así podrían realizar otras actividades , es por esa razón que quiere el préstamo para así comprar un sistema solar
texts.en:
Pablo is from the Sasama community. He is 46 years old and married. From this marriage, he had 3 daughters who are all grown now. His youngest daughter attends school in their community. He wants his daughters to be prepared and at least learn the basics, since the community and their economic situation don't allow him to give them much.

Pablo makes a living growing staple grains and vegetables. In this way and with much effort, he has provided for his family. Their community doesn't have electricity and he says at night and early morning, they have to use candles or oil lamps in order to see. He mentions that it's truly a necessity to have electricity in his home since that way they could do other activities. That's why he wants a loan to buy a solar energy system.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Adela has been engaged in cooking and selling meals and snacks within her community. Due to hardship of living, she aims to strengthen her business in order to generate sufficient income.

 She wants to cook and sell more kinds of recipes, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy pork, dressed chicken, vegetables, fish and seasonings needed to cook and sell. 

Through patience and hard work, she believes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pork, dressed chicken, vegetables, fish and seasonings.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of  three children, two of whom go to school, She resides in the family house, which has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

Mariam has been operating a drug shop for two years now. Working six days a week and selling on a retail basis, her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more syrups, tablets and syringes.   

Mariam aspires to own a fully-stocked drug shop and to earn enough profits to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy drugs such as panadol, centamol, septrin and syrups

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of shoes within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of shoes.

loans.name: Yuom's Group

texts.en:
Yuom is 34 years old and a married mother of five children. She lives in the Moungkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province. To overcome her family’s hardship she grows rice on four hectares of farmland as the main source of income and works as a paid worker to supplement her income. 

In this cycle, Yuom is a seventh-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of four for the loan. She has completely repaid her past loans successfully and it has enabled her to upgrade her standard of living in good pace. The total amount of her group loan is 3,500,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to uplift her condition of living better than before and to expand her business in larger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 45 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida, su hija y dos nietos de 2 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo tortillas y además tiene una pequeña venta de productos de primera necesidad, estas actividades las realiza en su vivienda. Su esposo también aporta a la economía del hogar por medio de su trabajo de ordenanza. Marta desea construir un cuarto para la cocina lo que le permitiría desarrollar mejor su trabajo de venta de tortillas es por ello que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos lo antes posible ya que el cuarto que tiene actualmente esta bastante deteriorado como se observa en la fotografía.
texts.en: Marta is 45 years old. She lives with her life partner, her daughter, and two grandchildren, ages 2 and 6. She is a very hardworking woman who earns a living selling tortillas and also selling staple goods. She does these activities at her home. Her husband also contributes to the household finances through his work as an administrative assistant. Marta wants to construct a room for a kitchen, which would allow her do her job selling tortillas better. That's why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails as soon as possible since the room she currently has is pretty run down, as you can see in the photo.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails as soon as possible to construct a room for a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Aniti

texts.en:
Aniti is 45 years old. She is married with four children (two sons and two daughters). They live in a small village, Bagribari, in Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district.  She and her husband both are uneducated. Three of their children are in school in different grades, and the eldest one works as a daily laborer.

Aniti's husband is engaged in a petty business. He has no consistent income. The earning of his son is also very scanty. So, their small income is unable to give sufficient financial sustenance to a family of six members. It can hardly cover their food expense. Though a housewife, Aniti is ambitious and hardworking. She desires sufficiency and continuous provision for her family.  She has started her tea selling shop in her locality. After managing her household, she engages herself in her business. She makes tea and sells to the passersby and to her neighbors. Her tea shop is situated on the main road of the village, so her business is a profitable one.

But, day by day, her customers are gradually increasing. Thus, she wants to expand her business. Aniti has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She plans to purchase ingredients such as tea leaves, sugar, milk, biscuits and other necessary things. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She is much thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for her existing tea shop.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 20-year-old, single man from Attell, a village near Tulkarem. He works with his father on the family's land where he plants it with seasonal crops. They use greenhouses to insure that they have a good quality. 

Abdel Rahman would like to improve the family's business and expand it in the future. He took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to rebuild the irrigation network for the new season. By taking this loan, Abdel Rahman will be able to improve the land and increase its productivity. 

Abdel Rahman appears in the photo on the family's land.

loans.use: to rebuild the irrigation network for the new season.

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en:
Merlito's mother is a housewife, while his father works as a painter. His father's income is not enough to pay for his tuition fees and support the needs of his two other siblings. 

Because of this, Merlito wants to borrow PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders, through ASKI. Merlito is currently in his college, studying electronics. He hopes that lenders will grant his loan request in order for him to continuously study.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en:
Pheang is a villager, originally from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 40 years old and a mother of one school child. 

Rice and cassava farming are the sources for her to earn income to feed the family, which she has been engaged in for 20 years. The business has earned her KHR 38,600 per day. 

This is Pheang's second loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and it has enabled her to provide sufficient food. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the leader, Pheang will use her entire loan portion to pay for land preparing and to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings. She hopes to uplift her standard of living at a good pace and to support her child to study to a high level.

loans.use: to pay for land preparing and to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Atibala

texts.en:
Atibala is a rural housewife of 56 years old with two sons. She lives with her husband and sons in their own house in Sahapara in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Atibala and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only. Due to poverty, they could not provide education to their sons. Her husband, Rupeswar, aged 59 years, is a car driver by profession. As he has grown old and feeble, and it has become difficult for him to continue to work, resulting in a financial crisis.

Atibala's grown-up sons are working to provide income for the household. As they are illiterate, they had no option to get any decent jobs. They are working as tailors. They have an old sewing machine, which they use to stitch garments like shirts, trousers, frocks, etc. They run the business from their house. Atibala also assists them after managing her household jobs. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighbourhood after she mastered the skills. Now that the prices of daily necessities are growing rapidly, she needs to produce more.

She heard about BJS (Kiva's partner) and that they give business loans to needy women; she has taken a loan from them. This loan will be used to strengthen her work. She will use the money to buy a sewing machine to stitch more clothing. This will win more contracts and make her business more profitable. The new sewing machine continues to motivate her so that she offers better service and she continues to fight so that her business operates fully.

She is thankful to the generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for their existing tailoring business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 36 años de edad, tez morena cabello negro rizado y ojos obscuros, vive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la panadería y trabaja sólo con un horno industrial instalado en una habitación de su hogar. 
Martha es una mujer trabajadora, fuerte y luchadora; su horario de trabajo comienza en la madrugada cuando todos duermen, prepara la masa para su pan lo hornea, luego lo almacena en canastas hasta terminar su pedido diario. Una vez que ha acabado de hornear toda su producción se dirige con sus canastas llenas a entregar algunos pedidos a tiendas del barrio amigas, luego se dirige al mercado dónde termina de vender los panes que le sobraron. 
Su vida diaria es la rutina de panadera que comparte con su familia, ella quiere expandir su negocio haciendo la compra de una máquina amasadora de pan, con esa máquina su producción será más rápida pudiendo producir mayores cantidades en menor tiempo, con esa mejora ella podrá ayudar a su familia y logrará mejores ingresos.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina amasadora de pan y con los beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 36 years old. She has tanned skin, black curly hair, and dark eyes. She lives with her partner and has two children. She makes a living making bread, and works only with one industrial oven, which is installed in a room in her home.

Martha is a hard-working woman, strong and determined. Her working hours start at dawn, when everyone is asleep. She kneeds the dough for her bread, bakes the loaves, then she stores them in baskets until she has filled her daily order. Once she is finished baking her entire production, she sets out with her full baskets to deliver some orders to friendly neighborhood stores, then to the market where she finishes selling the remaining loaves.

Her daily life is the bread-making routine, which she shares with her family. She wants to expand her business by purchasing a dough kneading machine. Her production will be faster with the machine, being able to produce larger quantities in shorter times. With that improvement she will be able to help her family and will obtain better earnings. Therefore, Martha requests a loan to buy a bread kneading machine, in order to help her family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy a bread kneading machine, and with the profit to help her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, sand, gravel, cement and pay labor for the construction of a laundry room and sink for her home.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 28-year-old woman. She is married to Kizito, who provides additional income for the family. Together they are blessed with five children.

Beatrice has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the last three years, earning an income of KES 20,000 at the end of every month.

Beatrice has requested her fourth loan of KES 80,000 from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to add to her personal savings to buy an additional motorcycle. Beatrice plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to improve the living standard for her family and become a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to add to her personal savings to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is a rural woman who hails from Maynaguri. She is 32 years old, married and a housewife. Her family compromises five members: she, her husband, Bhupen, and their three school-going children (one son and two daughters). She and her husband both have elementary education, and with much difficulty they are providing education to their children. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Bina's husband is a cycle-van puller. It is a mode of transport that is widely used in rural areas of West Bengal for carrying people and loads. He has endured many a hardship due to their poor economic condition. He has had to do many odd jobs to save money to buy a cycle-van, which he uses to carry goods and people to the local markets, nearest railway station and to other villages. But due to over usage, it has been damaged severely, and as a result, his income has been affected a lot. His economic opportunities can be much improved by a loan that will enable him to purchase a new van.

So, to help her husband, Bina has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a new cycle-van in order to improve her husband's business and provide better services to their customers. She believes that the loan will positively help her to strengthen her family economy. She aspires to provide her children with better education in a renowned school so that they come out successfully.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego es una persona de 50 años de edad, Casado, tiene dos hijos varones, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. Se dedica principalmente a la compra y venta del fruto de banano y Cacao, lleva veinte años en este negocio y cuenta con vehículo propio para poder comercializar la producción, es una actividad rentable en los alrededores de su comunidad, su principal mercado es la  regional del departamento, donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos, para poder ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de un lote de terreno. La meta a corto plazo es remodelar su vivienda y construir su cocina, con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is 50 years old, married and has two sons. They live in the department of Sololá. He mainly works buying and selling bananas and cacao. 

He has been in this business for 20 years and has his own vehicle that enables him to sell his output. It is a profitable activity in the area surrounding his community. His main market is the regional one of the department where he gets the greater part on his income that enables him to support his family. 

He is requesting a loan of 10,000 quetzales for the purchase of a plot of land. His short-term goal is to renovate his home and build his kitchen, with the aim of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is happy living with her husband and one kid. She manages their farming business which is planting and harvesting of rice in their field. She and her husband have managed their farm since they got married eleven years ago. Nelia states that it is getting hard to finance their farm because their income from making swing arms is enough only for their daily food. In connection to this, Nelia is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. She will also use the loan to pay for labor costs in planting and land preparation. Nelia believes that the loan is a big help for her, to reduce worries in providing their farm needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old, divorced, and she takes care of four children aged between 23 and 11 years. She has been selling cereals for the last two years and earns an income of 6,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this loan amount to buy more assorted cereals to sell, so that she can meet the demands of her customers. The profits she earns will be used to provide for the family’s basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy assorted cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sanad

texts.en:
Sanad is a 22-year-old single man from Tubas, a village near Nablus, Palestine. 

Sanad works as a farmer and plants his land with seasonal crops. He would like to improve his business and hopes to expand it in the future. Currently, Sanad is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy seeds and fertilizers for the new growing season. With this loan, Sanad will be able to improve his land and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for the new season

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat, a responsible 44-year-old mother of six children, is married to a farmer. For more than eight years, she has been busy growing agriculture products, mainly cotton, on two hectares of land. 

Last season Karomat  didn’t have a good harvest, so now she is going to sow onions and carrots. She is therefore requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for sowing of onion and carrots. Karomat awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support of the previous loan.  Here again she comes to you requesting a loan to buy charcoal, because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her three children who attend school, so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Due to capital insufficiency, Evangeline wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI for an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock for her store like canned goods, snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and frozen foods. Being a patient and diligent mother, she believes she will increase her income and satisfy the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and frozen food.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes African garments. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fabric for making African garments. 

Her business goal is to own an electric sewing machine within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate all her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fabric for making African garments.

loans.name: Chepkwony

texts.en:
Chepkwony lives in Kapsabet, a small town near Kakamega County. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rainforest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, along with the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Chepkwony is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifty years and are currently growing maize and tea. Chepkwony is excited about beekeeping as he can generate income from honey sales and produce honey for medicine.

This is Chepkwony's first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy food for his family. Chepkwony's hope for the future is to live a comfortable life in his old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: María de 21 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Pertenece al  Nuevo Grupo “El Milagro” y está conformada por 05 mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a comenzar a trabajar. María  es ama de casa. Gracias a su constante esfuerzo y dedicación ella puede educar a sus hijos. El crédito que solicitó lo destinara para acondicionar y ampliar su local. El deseo de María es tener su propio negocio de abarrotes. El nuevo grupo “El Milagro” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. María es la segunda del lado izquierdo. En la parte superior al lado izquierdo está Rudencinda la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old.  She is separated and has two children.  She is a part of the new group called "El Milagro" (The Miracle).  The group is made up of 5 entrepreneurial women who are ready to start working.  María is a homemaker.  Thanks to her constant effort and dedication she was able to educate her children.

The loan that she is seeking will be used to repair and expand her store.  María's dream is to have her own grocery store.

The "El Milagro" group is grateful for the people who have made this loan possible.  María is the second woman from the left.  In the top left corner is Rudencinda, who was not able to get to the meeting on time because of work.

loans.use: to repair and expand her store.

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en:
