Sokna, 27, is a resident from Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She is a married mother of two little kids. To cover her daily cost of living, she grows rice as the main source of income. She has been involved in this business for eight years. 

Including this cycle, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a leader of two to get the new loan. She has completely paid back her past loans with success, and this has enabled her to provide timely and sufficient meals for her family. 

Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,600,000 KHR, the same amount as her co-member. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for land preparation and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She strongly believes she will be able to increase her family’s income and send her children to study.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina and her family arrived to their community located in Oaxaca, Mexico 8 years ago. 

She is a housewife and she loves to prepare and give personal growth talks to her friends and members of the community. She is 43 years old and her husband Juan Gabriel is 41 years old; he is the provider of the family income.

Agustina and Juan Gabriel have two daughters: Tania (20) and Soraya (17). Soraya is married to Alexis (21) and their son is Barack (3).  Alexis is a hard-working young man but his wage is barely enough to help his wife and son.

Tania goes to school and Soraya helps her mom to do different chores at home and takes care of Barack. 
 
Mr. Juan (55) is Agustina´s brother.  Unfortunately, he has been sick since he was young  and he is afraid of photos. That´s why you can´t see his face.  

All of them are looking for a better future. Their priority is to own an adequate house with proper roof, windows and good structure because they do not want to suffer the weather conditions like they do living in the current house. 

The second dream they want to accomplish is to start their own business. They do not know what kind of business but are looking for one in which all the members can participate and work.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kapsabet, a small town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Joyce is married and has eight children. She is a business lady, and she undertakes farming with her husband. They have been farming for forty years now, and they are currently growing sweet potatoes and tea on their farm. Joyce is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Joyce's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Joyce's hope for the future is to have her grandchildren finish school.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Margoth De Los Angeles

texts.es: Margoth de 36 años de edad vive con sus 4 hijos 3 varones y una niña de 17 años de edad, además vive con ellos una nuera. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y presta sus servicios domésticos, dos de sus hijos apoyan con la economía familiar gracias a sus trabajos en la zona costera. Margoth desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra en muy malas condiciones como se observa en la fotografía, además desea construir las columnas de cemento por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y polines para cambiar el techo y cemento, arena y grava para construir las columnas de su vivienda.
texts.en: Margoth is 36 years old and lives with her four children, three boys and a 17 year old daughter.  A daughter-in-law also lives with them.  She is a very responsible woman who works as a maid.  Two of her children help her with the household expenses with the work in the coastal region.  Margoth hopes to replace the roof on her home since it is in very bad shape, as can be seen in the picture.  She also hopes to build cement columns.  She is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase sheet metal, nails and purlins to replace the roof, and cement, sand and gravel to build the columns.

loans.use: To purchase sheet metal, nails and purlins to replace the roof, as well as cement, sand and gravel to build columns for her home.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Inés de 57 años de edad vive con sus 2 nietas de 14 y 5 años de edad que tiene a su cargo. Ella es una mujer muy cariñosa y trabajadora que cuida a sus nietas, su hija emigro al extranjero para tratar de dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas. Inés desea terminar de mejorar su vivienda ya que actualmente falta terminar algunos detalles de las paredes que aun se encuentran en construcción es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI  lo antes posible para comprar cemento, arena y pintura para terminar con los arreglos de su vivienda.
texts.en: Inés is 57 years old and lives with her two granddaughters, ages 14 and 5, who she cares for.  She is a very caring and hardworking woman who takes care of her granddaughters.  Her daughter emigrated outside of the country to try and give her daughters a better quality of life.  Inés hopes to finish repairing her home since at the moment, she has to finish a few details with the walls that are still being built.  This is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI as soon as possible to purchase cement, sand and paint to finish with the repairs in her home.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand and paint to finish the repairs in her home.

loans.name: Bonnie

texts.en:
Bonnie is 32 years old and taking a care-giving course. He chose this course because he wants to take care of disabled people.

 Because he has seven siblings, there are times when Bonnie has difficulty meeting all expenses. That’s why he wants to avail a P10,000 loan from the KIVA lenders, to help him finance his schooling. He is optimistic that lenders will grant his loan request.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline owns a food stall business for neighbors and town-dwellers. Competition is a major challenge she faces, but she is working hard to be the best business lady.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en: Savorn is a 31-year-old, married mother of three children, two of whom are school age. Edible arum farming, and paid-working are the ways for her to earn income to feed her family. It is the business that she has had for seven years and she can earn 24,000 KHR per day. This is not the first cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has paid back her past loan, and it has enabled her to buy one decent motorbike and to uplift her living situation better than before. Now, she is leading the group of four to request the new loan. The total amount in her group is 3,500,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds, gasoline, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes increase her income from her business, so as she will able to build a decent shelter in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, gasoline, fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Kapsabet, a small town near Kakamega County. Kakamega is located in western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage.

David is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing tea and Napier grass, and they also keep dairy cattle. David is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is David's first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. David's hope for the future is to have his children finish school

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself to be a creative man. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and other items. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock like maize flour, wheat flour and other items.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 22 years old and  taking a care-giving course. Her family’s source of income is farming, so her everyday allowance is her major problem. 

Jonalyn wants to avail a Php10,000 loan from KIVA lenders to help pay her tuition. She  hopes that lenders will approve her loan request so that she can finish her studies.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Elsy Celina

texts.es: Elsy de 41 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su nuera. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y solidaria que apoya a su comunidad ya que es miembro de la directiva comunal y siempre esta buscando proyectos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su comunidad. Su esposo tuvo que emigrar al extranjero para tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Elsy desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, hierro, arena, grava y pagará mano de obra.
texts.en: Elsy is 41 years old and lives with her two children and her daughter-in-law.  She is a very hardworking and caring woman who supports her community as a member of the community council, and is always looking for projects to improve the community's quality of life.  Her husband had to emigrate out of the country in order to try and improve the family's quality of life.  Elsy hopes to build a room in her home, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, iron, sand, gravel and to pay for labor.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, iron, sand, gravel, and to pay for labor to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es: José de 44 años de edad que vive con sus 3 hijas 2 de ellas aportan a la economía familiar y una menor de 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como instalador de ventanas y puertas de vidrio, cielo falso, etc.  desde hace 10 años de forma domiciliar. José desea construir un muro de contención en su terreno por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar  ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y pagará mano de obra para la construcción del muro de contención.
texts.en: José is 44 years old and lives with his three daughters, two of whom contribute to the household finances, and one who is 12 years old.  He is a hardworking man who earns his living installing windows, glass doors, suspended ceilings, etc..  He has worked doing this in homes for the past 10 years.  José hopes to build a retaining wall on his property, which is why he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to build the retaining wall.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace 1 año se viene dedicando a la venta de mercancía variada como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Carlos.
Hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.
Inicio el negocio incentivado por su mama quien le enseño del negocio y hoy en día ya tiene sus propios clientes.
Solicita un préstamo para surtir su actividad con mercancía variada y de este modo poder aumentar su inventario y oferta de productos.
Esto le permitirá capitalizar su negocio y tener mucha más cantidad de mercancía disponible para sus clientes.
Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Carlos is an enterprising young man who has the drive to move forward and make progress. One year ago, he decided to sell a variety of merchandise such as clothing, accessories, beauty products, and household goods. He sells these products primarily to friends, neighbors, and relatives who know him. Today he has shown great skill in this line of work because of his charm and the excellent quality of service he provides.

Carlos was motivated to start working after his mother taught him the business. He now has his own customers. Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can stock his business with a variety of merchandise. This will increase his inventory and his product offerings. The loan will capitalize his business so that he can have more available merchandise that he can offer to his customers.

Carlos is hopeful of moving forward thanks to the assistance from kindhearted people who support these types of projects.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en: Yim is 50 years old and a resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Riep province. She is a widow and blessed with five children, only two of whom are currently her responsibility, and one is in school. Rice cropping on two hectares of farmland is the main source for her to earn income to cover her daily expenses. She has been in this business for 32 years and she can earn 33,900 KHR per day. She has been a borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles, which she has fully repaid and provided sufficient food in her family. Now, she is a leader of a group consisting of three to get the new loan. As the leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her rice farming. She hopes to collect more crop yields and to keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en: Amalya lives in Lusakert village, in the Shirak region. She lives there with her husband and three teenage children. The family owns a retail store where they sell various food products. Amalya's husband also works as a teacher at the local secondary school. Amalya now wants to expand her family's business a little bit. She has applied for a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase more food items to stock her store. As this is Amalya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Mrs. Giang  is a hardworking woman, 34 years old. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. With more than 10 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Tuyet is 31 years old, married and has two children, two of them are in school. She works very hard to feed & educate her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from fishing and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Mrs. Sau is 50 years old .There are five people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members.  She has daily income from gardening and producing vegetables, chicken and pig. Mrs. Sau is 50 years old .There are five people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Mrs. Lien is a hard working woman, 37 years old. She is married and has  four children. Her income is mainly from small business and fishing. With more than 20 years experiences and has support from her husband, her income is enough to allow her to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Mrs. Ty is 60 years old. She lives with her husband in a small house without hygienic latrine. Fishing is the main income of her family. She sells fish and has been in this business for 10 years. She has also daily income from gardening such as chicken, duck and vegetable. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Ma. Hipolita

texts.en: Ma. Hipolita calmly feels joy when she says that she is sending her two children to school. She is happy because she and her husband have experienced  hardship but they have overcome it and their eldest child has successfully finished college and is now presently working at a known company. Ma. Hipolita is proud that through farming, they are able to send their children to school. Ma. Hipolita's greatest dream is to have her youngest child finish her studies and became a professional someday. With their farming business, Ma. Hipolita believes that she can achieve her dream. With this, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides for their farm. She hopes to grow her rice with good quality, to have higher earnings that she will use for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for their farm

loans.name: Mary Flor

texts.en: Mary Flor is 48 years old and has two children. While she takes care of her grandchild, she manages a small retail store within their community. She aims to further improve the business and to make it more profitable to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to request a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy additional stock to sell like soft drinks, laundry soaps, shampoos, assorted biscuits, candies, beverages and seasonings. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soft drinks, laundry soaps, shampoos, assorted biscuits, candies, beverages and seasonings.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a very young and energetic entrepreneur. She hails from Maynaguri. She is 27, married and blessed with one young son. She studied up to grade eight; then her parents could not afford the expenses of her education, and so she got married. She lives with her husband, Anupam, and their only son in Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Champa's husband is engaged in a business of selling turmeric powder. It is a dry yellow powder made by dry grinding of mature turmeric stems. It is used in cooking for color and flavor. He purchases turmeric powder in bulk quantities from wholesale sellers. Then, with the help of Champa, he makes small sachets of the turmeric powder, which he supplies to the local shops. In the rural, improvised area where they live, all these efforts earn an income that is sufficient for a small family like theirs. Champa sees the potential to expand their family business, as they are facing more demands.

So, she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to add to their inventory volume. The loan will help them increase their sales and, therefore, their income and savings, helping them access an improved standard of living. She dreams to admit her son to a renowned school.

She appreciates the lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase turmeric powder in bulk for her husband's business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 28-year-old woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 7 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells utensils. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to expand the business into other towns within 5 years. She hopes, in the future, to own different branches all over the town. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in Kakamega. Kakamega County is located in western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Michael is married and has five children. He is a farmer while his wife is a business lady. He has been farming for ten years now and he is currently growing maize and sugarcane and he keeps cows and poultry on his farm. Michael is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey, as well as provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Michael's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his projects. Michael's hope for the future is to live a comfortable life and to have his children finish school.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Mrs. Lam  is 62 years old. There are five people in her family. Fishing is the main income source of her family. She can cover her family’s daily cost and education from selling fish, which her son caught. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Quyet

texts.en: Mrs. Quyet is a hardworking woman, 49 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for his home.

loans.name: The

texts.en: Mrs. The  is 41 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standard as well as environmental protection

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Herberth Ramon

texts.es: Herberth de 36 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se gana la vida instalando cielos falsos, ventanas y puertas de vidrio de lunes a viernes  desde hace 16 años . Herberth desea colocar ladrillo de piso para lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena, además pagará mano de obra para que le coloquen el ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en: Herberth, age 36, lives with his partner and their two children, ages 14 and 10. He is a very hard-working man who makes a living installing suspended ceilings, windows, and glass doors. He works Mondays to Fridays, and has been doing so for 16 years. Heberth wants to lay a brick floor, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of bricks for flooring, as well as cement and sand, and to pay the labourers to lay the prick floor in his home.

loans.use: to buy bricks for flooring; cement; and sand; and to pay labourers to lay the brick floor of his home.

loans.name: Claudia Emerita

texts.es: Claudia de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijas 2 mayores y una menor de 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida vendiendo joyería de oro y plata como: pulseras, cadenas , anillos, arracadas y reloges desde hace 6 años.  Claudia desea construir un cuarto dentro de su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava y también pagar mano de obra para la construcción de el cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her three daughters, two who are adults and one who is 12 years old.  She is a tenacious woman who has made a living selling gold and silver jewelry, including: bracelets, chains, rings, pendant earrings, and watches for six years.  

Claudia wants to build a room in her home, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and to pay for laborers to build the room in her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and pay for laborers to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Gevin

texts.en:
Gevin lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Gevin is married and has one child. He is a motor bike transporter while his wife is a housewife. They undertake farming as well. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, sugarcane, bananas, and trees in their farm. Gevin is excited about beekeeping as it does not require a lot of input and it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Gevin's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives and invest in other projects. Gevin's hope for the future is to have a good life and to have his children finish school.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Phina

texts.en: Phina is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is 50 years old, living with her family members in a rural village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is married with seven children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 11 years. To supplement the income, she also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 47,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 21,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Ly has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Ly wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado. Está felizmente casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de especias y sus dos hijas están en la escuela, una en último año de bachillerato y otra hija trabaja en la ciudad, actualmente viven en casa de la mamá de María.

María, desde el nacimiento de su primera hija se ha comprometido a trabajar arduamente en los cuidados del hogar, mientras su esposo se dedica a traer el alimento a su casa. Él tiene que viajar  unos 25 minutos en carro a la ciudad, para ir a distribuir su producto (cominos, canela, pimienta, orégano, ajonjolí, cebada etc).

La familia necesita el dinero para tres cosas, una para invertir en comprar cominos, canela, pimienta, orégano, ajonjolí, cebada etc, otra para hacerle arreglos mecánicos al carro y otra para la compra de 4 cerdos los cuales engordará para luego obtener ingresos de ellos.

María sueña con que sus hijos crezcan y lleguen a ser profesionales y personas de bien y también en construir una casa propia, la cual heredarán a alguna de sus hijas.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and studied through the ninth grade. She is happily married and her husband works as a spice trader. Their two daughters are in school. One is in her last year of high school and the other daughter works in the city and is currently living at the home of María’s mother.

After the birth of her first daughter, María committed herself to working hard at taking care of her household while her husband provided for the family. He travels approximately 25 minutes by car into the city in order to sell his products (cumin, cinnamon, pepper, oregano, sesame, barley, and other items).

The family needs money for three things: 1) to invest in the purchase of cumin, cinnamon, pepper, oregano, sesame, barley, and other products; 2) to make mechanical repairs to her husband’s vehicle; and 3) to buy four pigs for fattening so that she can generate income when she sells them later.

María dreams of watching her children grow, seeing them become professionals and good people, and building a house of her own that she can leave as an inheritance to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy spices for her husband's business, to pay for repairs to her husband's vehicle, and to buy four pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana de 60 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado,es viuda hace poco murió su esposo,ella desde hace años tiene un pequeño negocio de productos de primera necesidad,vive con sus nietos en casa propia.


Ana  tiene un negocio de productos de la canasta básica,desde hace varios años,ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque tenia cinco hijos pequeños y tenia que darles lo que necesitaban, sus hijos también le ayudaban, ahora sus hijos ya están grandes pero siempre mantiene su tienda. 

 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar azúcar, arroz, frijoles, sal, detergentes, embutidos, galletas, etc. mas productos de primera necesidad y así tener mas surtido y que los clientes encuentren mas variedad y no se vayan para otro lugar y de esa forma lograra obtener mas ingresos y darles lo necesario a sus nietos y mejor su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Ana  es siempre tener su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus nietos puesto que todos sus hijos ya están a parte.
texts.en:
Ana, age 60, only studied until grade 2. She is a widow; her husband passed away recently. She has had a small store for several years where she sells basic staples. She lives with her grandchildren in her own home.
Ana has a business selling basic staples. She has had this business for several years. She decided to start this business because she had five small children and needed to provide for them. Her children also helped her. They are grown now, but she still has her store.
She needs this loan for the purchase of sugar, rice, beans, salt, detergent, sausages, cookies, etc, in order to have more stock so that her clients will find more variety and won't go elsewhere. This way, she will make a better income and provide for her grandchildren, as well as improve their quality of life.
Ana's dream is to always have her business and to give her grandchildren a good education, since all her children live independently.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, salt, detergent, sausages, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson lives in Kakamega. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage.

Renson is married and has five children. He is a pastor. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and sugarcane. Renson is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Renson's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to start a business. Renson's hope for the future is to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, de tez morena, cuerpo delgado su cabello es negro como la noche y sus ojos marrones, es soltero y sin hijos. 
Miguel vive en la ciudad de El Alto a una altura aproximada de 4 mil metros sobre el nivel del mar y a 30 minutos de la ciudad de La Paz. Su carácter es de emprendedor constante, su negocio actual es una librería propia que atiende todos los días desde hace cinco años, ahora tiene nuevo material como una máquina anilladora de hojas y un teléfono público, siempre está en la búsqueda de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su juventud le da muchas ganas de seguir mejorando su negocio, él está buscando la manera de mejorar el stock y aumentar la oferta de productos porque pronto se acerca la fiesta de su barrio y él quiere estar preparado para ese momento. Miguel sueña con continuar sus estudios, piensa que necesita una oportunidad que le dará su negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para ampliar su librería y con los beneficios pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 22 year old young man.  He is brown skinned, thin, his hair is black as the night, and his eyes are brown.  He is single and has no children.  Miguel lives in the city of El Alto, which is located 4,000 meters above sea level and 30 minutes from the city of La Paz.  He has an enterprising character.  His current business is a bookstore that he has worked at every day for five years.  Now he has new material, including a binding machine and a public telephone.  He is always in search of ways to satisfy the needs of his customers.

His youth has given him a lot of desire to continue improving his business.  He is searching for a way to improve his stock and increase the products that he offers since the local festival is approaching and he wants to be prepared.  Miguel dreams of continuing his schooling and thinks that his business will give him the opportunity he needs.  

Miguel is requesting a loan to expand his bookstore and use the profits to pay for his studies.

loans.use: to expand his bookstore and pay for his studies with the profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, iron, a blackboard, seats, markers, and erasers.

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
María, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos a su cargo, reside en la iguala Lempira con sus hijos y su madre. Tiene doce años de dedicarse a cultivar sus propias parcelas de café. Esta producción es vendida en la zona ya despulpado el café. Ella solicita un segundo préstamo en forma grupal, el cual es por 8,500 lempiras para comprar 8 bolsas de abono para fertilizar su parcela de café, y poder mejorar la producción. Su plan es darles educación a sus hijos y mejorar la condición de vida.
El grupo se llama Nueva Jerusalén, esta integrado por 15 personas, que se dedican a realizar actividades agrícolas y viven en la misma comunidad. El monto total del grupo es por 120,500 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar sus fincas de café. 
En la foto están: atrás al lado izquierdo Alejandro  de camiseta a rayas color café y blanco, sigue Moisés camisa cuadriculada con rojo, Alejandro con camisa gris oscuro, Rafael con camisa celeste, Jose con camiseta amarilla, Jose marcos con camiseta café claro a rayas, Faustino camiseta blanca, Macario camisa rayada color gris claro, Juan camiseta azul oscuro con rayas celeste a la derecha, al frente a la izquierda esta María soledad blusa verde claro y falda jeans, Ma. Susana vestido salmón, María Albertina blusa gris y cartera, Maria Emérita blusa café con rayas de centro, Quirian blusa estampada y Simona vestido fucsia a la derecha.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and a single mother with three dependent children. She resides in Lempira along with her children and her mother. For the past 12 years, María has been cultivating coffee on her own land. Whatever she produces is sold locally with the pulp already removed. She is requesting her second loan as part of a group. Her portion amounts to 8,500 HNL and will be used to buy eight bags of compost so that she can fertilizer her coffee crops and improve production. Her plan is to provide for her children’s education and to improve their living conditions.

This group is called Nueva Jerusalén (New Jerusalem), which consists of 15 members who engage in farming activities and live in the same community. The amount of the group loan totals 120,500 HNL and will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for their coffee farms.

The photo shows the members as follows (in the back, starting on the left):
• Alejandro is wearing a dark brown and white striped shirt.
• Moisés is wearing a red checkered shirt.
• Alejandro is wearing a dark gray shirt.
• Rafael is wearing a blue shirt.
• Jose is wearing a yellow T-shirt.
• Jose Marcos is wearing a T-shirt with tan stripes.
• Faustino is wearing a white T-shirt.
• Macario is wearing a light gray striped shirt.
• Juan is wearing a dark blue T-shirt with light blue stripes.

(In the front, starting on the left):
• María Soledad is wearing a light green blouse and a denim skirt.
• Ma. Susana is wearing a salmon-colored dress.
• María Albertina is wearing a gray blouse and has a purse.
• María Emérita is wearing a brown blouse with stripes in the middle.
• Quirian is wearing a printed blouse.
• Simona is wearing a fuchsia dress.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of compost for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and herbicides for their farm.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Age 47 years, Sima is a married mother of six children living in the Memot district of Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who has grown cassava for three years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day to meet the needs of the family. 

This is the third loan for Sima with VisionFund, and she completely paid back the first two loans, which have helped her better support her family. 

Now she is applying for a loan to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice production to increase her family’s income; she hopes to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Tiththeary's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two kids, a schoolchild and under school-aged child, residing in Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Thiththeary is 29 years old. To make a living, she is growing rice and works as construction worker to earn more income. She has engaged with this business for five years, and she can earn 36,400 KHR in return. 

This is not the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a leader of a group of four to get a new loan. 

For her past loan, which she has fully repaid with success, enabled her to give her kids timely meals. 

As the leader in this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy clothes and school materials for her kid, and to buy food as well. 

She strongly believes that her situation of living will improve from before.

loans.use: To buy clothes and school materials for her kid, and to buy food as well

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Philip, a strong, hardworking and passionate farmer who is 36 years of age and hails from the Bomet area of Kenya, an area that has got wonderful weather patterns that favor animal and crop farming. Philip is a family man, and he has a very beautiful wife and five children that he really adores and cherishes. Being very hardworking, he has been practicing farming for the past two years, and through farming he has been able to provide the basic needs for his lovely family.

Philip is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a dairy cow and be able to fully satisfy the demand for milk in his area. Because of an increase in population, the demand for milk has gone up, but the supply is so low and that is why Philip wants to take advantage of the situation and try to reap more from selling milk. 

The Bomet area has got one of the best weather patterns, and therefore animal food is not a problem because there is plenty of grass and milk production is so high. Through the loan he is sure that his young family will have the basic needs and provide a good educational foundation for his children.

Philip is a dreamer, and he projects that his business will be able to satisfy the client base and the markets around, hence accumulating more profits. Having gone through the repayment schedule, he is sure of repaying the loan and even asking for more loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en:
Joanes is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a big business boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a quality business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary operates a food kiosk business, selling maize flour, rice  and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentions high costs and seasonality as her major challenges. 

With this Kshs 30,000 loan, Mary wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Mary dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future, and she appreciates the support provided by her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Leydi Yamileth

texts.es:
Leydi, utiliza los créditos como herramientas para fortalecer el negocio con la materia prima que necesita para elaborar la venta de antojitos, con ayuda del financiamiento anterior mejoro su situación económica y las circunstancias familiares.
 El capital que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar maíz, condimentos, bolsas, yuca, repollo, tomates, etc., y concentrado para las aves de corral, continuara manteniendo su negocio activo y generando recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Leydi uses the loans as a tool for strengthening her business. She was able to buy the supplies that she needed to make snacks to sell. With the help of her previous loan, she improved her financial situation and her family’s circumstances.

The capital she is requesting now is needed to buy corn, condiments, bags, cassava, cabbage, tomatoes, and other supplies. She will also buy concentrated feed for her chickens. Leydi can continue to maintain an active business and generate an income.

loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, bags, cassava, cabbage, tomatoes, other supplies, and concentrated poultry feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina nutricional, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy estratégica cerca de su casa por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más medicina por mayor y así poder aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias, para tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is 25 years old and resides in her own home along with her mother. She sells nutritional medicines. Her business is situated in a strategic location near her home. For this reason, she has many customers. With what she earns from her sales, the borrower is able to help with some of the household necessities.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more medicines in bulk, which will help to increase her sales and earnings. As a result, she and her mother can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nutritional medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en: Janeta is a self-employed woman from Noramarg village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). The family is fully engaged in agricultural activities. In particular, they breed livestock (cattle, hens) and cultivate various fruits and vegetables. Janeta and her husband want to expand their agribusiness and make it more profitable. Janeta has applied for a loan of USD 3,000 to buy three cows. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 42 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo  y con sus hijos, de 20 y 15 años. Vive en el  Cantón Pueblo viejo provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 
El crédito solicito para la comprar de fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
le gusta ver television y arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her children who are 20 and 15 years old.  She lives in the Pueblo canton in the province of Los Rios.  Her community bank is called La Paulina and it is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the La Paulina neighborhood in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of the community bank work in agriculture and livestock.

Sonia has worked as a farmer planting corn for many years.  She purchases her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same location.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer to plant corn and rice.  The loan will help her change her family's quality of life.  Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and give her children the best.  She likes to watch television and clean her home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is 34 years old and married with two children. Being a responsible mother, Nilufar works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send some of her children to school.  She is dedicated to the farming business, growing rice and onions on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has worked hard from early morning until late evening for ten years. She would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers for the new planting season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Damary

texts.en: Damary is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a trade business where she sells water. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water during dry seasons. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional water cans for storing water. Her business goal is to grow her water business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful and stable life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional water cans for storing water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Luz America

texts.es: Luz vive en el campo en donde el sustento de ella y su familia es la agricultura, Luz se dedica a la siembra de los productos propios de su comunidad, Luz vive con su esposo que es agricultor y con sus 3  hijos  de 11, 13 y 15 años en una casa que le dio el bono del gobierno ecuatoriano, con el crédito Luz va a comprar abono y fungicidas para cuidar sus cultivos de los que espera obtener una buena cosecha y de ahí educar a sus 3 hijos que en la actualidad están estudiando.
texts.en: Luz lives in the country, where she and her family support themselves through agriculture.  Luz makes her living planting items typical to her community.  Luz lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their three children, who are 11, 13 and 15 years old.  Their house was given to them through an Ecuadoran government grant.  With this loan, Luz is going to purchase compost and fungicides to take care of her crop and hopefully get a good harvest.  She will then be able to educate her three children, who aren't currently going to school.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides and compost.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man and has children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

He has operated a photo shop business for the past two years, taking photographs at functions and in the neighborhood. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially when no functions are held; hence the business is low.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase a new photo machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase a new photo machine for his business

loans.name: Olimpio Valentin

texts.es:
Olimpio tiene 64 años de edad estado civil unión libre,  vive con su esposa en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Olimpio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímicos Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar su economía. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.
Le gusta viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Olimpio is 64 years old and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called La Paulina and is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which is in La Paulina precinct, Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank focuses on livestock and agricultural work. 

Olimpio earns a living by growing corn and rice, as well as by raising chickens. He buys goods at Agroquímicos Briones in Ventanas and he sells them in the market in the same area.

Olimpio has requested this loan to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for his rice and corn crops. The loan has helped him to improve his financial situation. His dream is to buy his own land. He enjoys traveling with his family.

loans.use: to grow short-cycle corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise like national soccer team shirts, flags, hats, socks etc.

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sokhoern is aged 44 years and the mother of two children. For the last 15 years, Sokhoern has been working as a rice farmer to support her family. Besides this, she also works as a paid worker. She can earn about 33,000 KHR per day.

Sokhoern has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. Sokhoern wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and manure, among other items.

loans.name: Norma Maricela

texts.es:
Norma tiene 27 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos, de 1 y 2 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Norma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Dr. Agro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, insecticidas y semillas.
El préstamo le ayudado para cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es tener un terrero para construir una casa.
Le gusta viajar con su familia y ver television.
texts.en:
Norma is 27-years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children, who are 1- and 2- years old respectively.  She lives in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province.
The "La Paulina" communal bank is located in Puerto Pechiche Parrish, La Paulina Precinct, which is a part of Pueblo Viejo  Canton.  The members of the communal bank make their livings in agricultural and ranching work. 
Norma makes her living in agriculture.  She has planted corn and rice for a few years.  She purchases her supplies in Ventanas at Dr. Agro, and she sells her products in the market there.
Norma is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, compost, insecticide and seeds. 
The loan has helped her to change her family's standard of living.  Norma's dream is to have some land to build a house on. 
Norma lives to travel with her family and watch television.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 34-year-old married mother of three who started her own business in September 2012, to support her beloved husband in covering their increasing living needs.

Her business is home-based; she bakes bread and the famous traditional Manakish. She is well known in her neighborhood with the special taste of bread she serves. 

Mariam also sells Brazilian gold as an additional income business. She is working hard to develop both businesses in a well-managed way. So, she acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her bakery widely. She will buy a TV, a refrigerator, tables, and chairs so that she can accommodate customers and enjoy their eating.

She hopes that in the future she can establish a wide bakery where she can produce different kinds of bread and baked sweets.

loans.use: to buy a TV, refrigerator, tables, and chairs to develop her bakery widely and so that she can accomodate customers and enjoy their eating

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo is widow with six children, two are in school. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water . She doesn't incur any extra transportation costs because she both buys and sells from her place of work. She sells the local brew and gin on retail basis. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and medication. She has been in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 UGX to buy jerrycans of local brew and spirits . She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin.She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of local brew and spirits

loans.name: Mut's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village, located in the Kampong Cham province’s Choeng Prey district, Mut is 53 and married with seven children. For the last 35 years, she has been growing cassava on 2 hectares of farmland. She also works as a paid worker to earn more income. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day to make a living and she can save about 18,000 KHR each day for her future needs. 

This is the first loan for Mut with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow more cassava so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 16 years to 3 years. She describes herself to be independent. She operates a grocery stand where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in the market and her primary customers are local. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop famine. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of tomatoes. Her business goal is to own a grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will operate a successful independent business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Nader Group

texts.en:
Nader is a group which comprises of four members, women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

Afrah is the leader of the group. She is a 41-year-old, married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest one is 5 years old. She studied until the elementary education, but she couldn't complete her studies. Afrah's husband is an employee. Most times, his salary isn't enough to cover all the expenses of the family. This creates problems in the living standards of the family. So, Afrah wants to help her husband in the expenses of her family. She wants to improve the living standards of the family through saving all kinds of food materials inside the house in order to face all the needs of the family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of  20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house to face the needs of the family.

Afrah looks forward to expanding her house through building more of one floor in order to make the house larger.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house to face the needs of the family

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Souy is a 57-year-old mother of six dependent children. To support her children, Souy has been farming rice for 39 years while her husband has been working as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 49,000 KHR per day and can save about 21,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Souy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to sell for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 23 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a farmer, and when he has a free time he does carpentry for an additional source of income. Aiza wants to help her husband, even in a simple way. She knows that her husband's income is not enough to sustain their family's needs. Aiza engages herself in a retail business, which is selling of variety of grocery items in their village. Aiza needs additional capital to extend the items of the grocery she offers to her costumers. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy drinks, biscuits, condiments, and spices. Aiza hopes to grow the business for a continuous source of income that enables her to provide for their daily foods.

loans.use: to buy drinks, biscuits, condiments, and spices,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more items such as rice, oil, butter, cube, onion, pepper, okra etc

loans.name: Jaime Andres

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Jaime es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia compuesta por su esposa y un hijo de 10 años.
Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para iniciar con sus labores diarias. Se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos de engorde en una pequeña finca ubicada en zona rural del municipio de Támesis. Con esta actividad ha podido sostener a su familia sin mencionar los trabajos que realiza en otras fincas como jornalero.
El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de su negocio y es ésta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos de engorde, gallinas ponedoras y concentrados para alimentarlos, con este apoyo podrá continuar con su actividad y podrá seguir soñando con un futuro prometedor para su familia.
texts.en:
Nowadays, working in the field is one of the hardest jobs there is, due to the great effort that must be done in order to progress. However, Jaime is a man who has never given up, in spite of bad weather or other circumstances. He is always willing to come up with the resources for his family, formed by his wife and 10-year-old son. 

He gets up early in the morning to start with his daily labors. He raises and sells broilers in a small farm located in the rural area of the town of Támesis. With this activity he has been able to sustain his family, without taking into account the other works he makes in different farms as a laborer. 

He wishes to increase his working capital to guarantee the continuation of the business. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan. He will invest it in the purchase of chickens for fattening, laying hens and poultry feed. With this help, he will be able to continue with his business and keep dreaming about a promising future for his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Lorenzo Antonio

texts.es:
Lorenzo de 27 años de edad, es un agricultor y comerciante de la zona. Su preparación académica solo abarca hasta 8º grado de educación básica.  Está acompañado y solo tiene un hijo el cual tiene 9 años y está estudiando.


La actividad desempeñada por Lorenzo es la compra venta de ganado, esta actividad la aprendió de su tío quien toda su vida se ha dedicado a dicha actividad. Lorenzo camina todos los días por los cantones en busca de ganado como vacas, toros, bueyes e incluso hasta cerdos que los lugareños estén interesados en vender para él comprarlos; luego si considera que debe dar un cuido mas especial al animal lo tiene tiene un par de meses y luego los saca a vender al tiangue que hay todos los martes y de esta forma obtiene ganancias, además de esto también se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz y frijol.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar más ganado, ya con el capital que cuenta no le alcanza para seguir trabajando y poder llegar hacer buenas inversiones puesto que en ocasiones hay momentos en que se queda corto para comprar ganado.

Desde que se ha dedicado a esta actividad Lorenzo siempre a tenido un sueño y es poder llegar a tener un vehículo con el cual pueda transportar su ganado cuando lo esta comprando, también sabe que le será mucho mas fácil movilizarse ya que tendrá que estar llamando a una persona para que le haga el viaje este , es su sueño y sabe que de apoco con la ayuda de este crédito él podrá ir alcanzando este sueño.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a 27-year-old farmer and merchant in this area.  He only went to school until 8th grade of primary school.  He is in a relationship and he has only one son who is 9 years old and in school.  

He makes a living buying and selling livestock.  He learned the trade from his uncle who was a livestock trader for his entire life.  Every day, Lorenzo walks through the surrounding cantons searching for livestock such as cows, bulls, oxen, and even pigs that the locals are interested in selling to him.  After that, he provides special care to the animals for a few months and then takes them to a small market every Tuesday to sell and gain his income.  In addition to this, he cultivates basic grains such as corn and beans.  

The loan he is asking for from CREDICAMPO is for buying more livestock, since he doesn't have enough capital to continue working and be able to make good investments since there are times when he comes up short for buying livestock.

Since he started working in this trade, Lorenzo has always had a dream to be able to buy a vehicle to transport the livestock that he buys.   It would be much easier for him to get around since now he has to call someone to make the trip for him.  This is his dream and he knows that with the help of this loan, little by little he will be able to reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es: Maria es una señora muy trabajadora que se dedica a la ganadería y al jornal de trabajo en el campo juntamente con su esposo, ella tiene 6 hijos de los que solo una hija y 2 nietos  vive con ella, María comenta que la vida en el campo no es nada fácil ya que para ordeñar sus vacas tienen que salir de su casa desde las 4 de la mañana y que de ahí tienen que regresar pronto  para irse al jornal a las 7 de la mañana, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para mejorar su negocio y ayudar a su hija la que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking woman who makes a living raising livestock and working in the country together with her husband. She has 6 children of which just one is a girl and two grandchildren who live with her. 

Maria says that life in the country is not easy and that in order to take care of her cows they have to leave the house at 4 in the morning, and from there they must return soon in order to start the workday at 7 in the morning. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a cow to improve her business and help her daughter who is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby clothes, powder, and baby underwear for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, nails and wood, and to hire labor to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en: Dorine is a married woman. She describes herself as patient. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be better. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro-finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kimsreng's Group

texts.en:
Aged 35 years, Kimsreng lives in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia. She is a married mother of one daughter, who is still young for school. For the last 20 years, Kimsreng has been buying and selling rubber resin and also working for others for a fee. 

She can earn about 37,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 18,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is the second loan for Kimsreng with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy more resin for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more resin to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies that will help to protect her coffee crop.

loans.name: Diego Gerardo

texts.es:
Diego tiene 54 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con la esposa  y con sus 8 hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Diego  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y a la cría de cerdos desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y la alimentación para los animale. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para su familia. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un terreno.
Le gusta trabajar y reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Diego is 54 years old and lives with his wife in a common-law marriage and with his 8 children. He lives in the township of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank, La Paulina, is located in the Puerto Pechiche territory in the La Paulina district, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo township. This communal bank is dedicated to labors in agriculture and livestock.

Diego earns a living working in agriculture planting corn and rice, and raising pigs for the last few years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same area. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what is needed for planting, and for feeding the animals. The previous loan helped him to increase his income for his family. His dream is to have enough money to buy a piece of land. He likes to work and get together with family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Melissa Laura

texts.es:
Melissa es una joven emprendedora, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Pisco junto a su familia.
es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está estudiando una carrera técnica en un Instituto porque tiene muchos deseos de superación.
Desde hace más de 6 meses trabaja como asistente de Publicidad y Marketing en una prestigiosa empresa, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo porque siempre se preocupa por ejercer de la mejor manera sus actividades.
Melissa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprarse una laptop para poder realizar sus trabajos de la Universidad, de esta manera seguirá esforzándose para poder más adelante "Terminar sus estudios universitarios" y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Melissa is an enterprising young woman.  She is 22 years old, single, and lives in Pisco with her family. 
Melissa is a person with a great desire to get ahead.  She is studying a technical degree at an Institute because she really wants to do better for herself. For the last six months, she has been working as a Marketing and Publicity assistant for a prestigious business.  It has been going very well for her because she is very responsible, hard working and, above all else, always concerned with doing the best work possible in all her activities. 
Melissa is grateful for the Kiva lenders.  With the help they have provided her, she will be able to buy herself a laptop to keep up with her studies at the University.  She will then be able to keep working hard toward, in the future, completing her college education and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assortment for her store

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is 46 years old. She is from Maynaguri. She lives with her husband, Sabindranath, and four daughters. Three daughters are students in different grades at secondary level; one is too young for school. They live in the village Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district. Sumitra is illiterate, but her husband has primary education.

Sumitra's husband is associated with a small business. This way he tries to earn income for the family. Sumitra, who is energetic and active, helps her husband in his business. This is the only source of income for the family, so they work tirelessly to improve their business. Their main challenge is capital. Their earnings are quite insufficient to cover all the household expenses. They have cultivable ancestral land, which they want to use to cultivate jute. This crop has good potential and is profitable too; that's why they have chosen this crop for cultivation.

Sumitra is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase good quality jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes this loan will help her to respond to her customers' demands and at the same time earn good profit to strengthen her family's economy; thus, achieving a better standard of living and better education for her children. 

Sumitra conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season, it becomes hard to operate. Her dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to service her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Los Puntualitos Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS PUNTUALITOS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosmery tiene 28 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de tienda de abarrotes,transporte,libreria.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank LOS PUNTUALITOS. It is located in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

Rosmery is 28 years old, has one child and is married. She alternates her daily activities with the restaurant business. She has had this business for a while now, and it has gone well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. 

She makes different kind of dishes, like chicken with rice, saltado, and soups, among others. She wishes to keep working so she can continue supporting her family.

Rosmery is requesting a loan to buy supplies, like oil, rice, and others.

She is thankful for the given loan and commits to comply with the payments.

The other members of the communal bank have different businesses, like grocery stores, transportation, and a library.

loans.use: to buy supplies, like oil, rice, and others.

loans.name: Nicanor Llarea Group

texts.es:
La socia Judith pertenece al banco comunal NICANOR LLAREA,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Judith tiene  30 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez vende cerveza, gaseosas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura,restaurante,venta de cereales.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the "Nicanor Llarea" communal bank.  The bank is located in Santa Ana District, La Convención Province, Cusco Department.
Judith is 30-years old, has one child and is single.  She divides her time between her daily chores and a food-sales business.
