She has made her living with the business for a long time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  Judith also sells beer, sodas and other items.  She hopes to be able to keep up with her business in order to continue supporting her family. 
Judith is requesting the loan to purchase supplies, such as cooking oil, rice and other items. 
She feels grateful for the loan she has been granted, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan. 
The other members of the communal bank make their livings in agriculture, running a restaurant and selling grains.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as cooking oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Santiago Alcides

texts.es:
Santiago de 56 años de edad,  es un agricultor que no logro estudiar debido a que sus padres no lo pudieron poner a estudiar sino que lo mandaron desde muy pequeño a trabajar. Su esposa falleció de una enfermedad en los riñones y tiene dos hijos que ya no viven con él, se fueron a  vivir muy lejos y con ellos solo vive un nieto el cual vive con él por la distancia a su lugar educativo ya que esta yendo al bachillerato.


 Santiago desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar  maíz, esa es su actividad a la cual se dedica desde que tenia 10 años de edad.  Ahora cultiva dos hectáreas de tierra que alquila cada año en los meses de mayo o junio para ir preparando la tierra. Santiago se levanta muy temprano para ir a ver la cosecha cuando esta ya esta sembrada.

El préstamo que esta  solicitando, es para comprar abono y foliares ya que su cultivo esta próximo a producir la cosecha y necesita aplicarle la ultima abonada a su milpa.

Su sueño es ver a  su nieto  graduado del bachillerato sin ningún problema, ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad cuando era joven, ahora él se la está dando a su nieto y sabe que lo podrá lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Santiago is 56 years old.  He is a farmer who was not able to study since his parents could not allow him to, because he was sent to work at a very young age.  His wife died of a kidney disease and he has two children who live very far away from him.  He has a single grandchild who lives with him because of the distance from the high school that he is attending.

 Since he was very little, Santiago's parents taught him to grow corn, and he has made a living at it since he was 10 years old.  Presently he cultivates two hectares of land that he rents every year from May to June to go about preparing the land.  Santiago gets up very early to tend to his crops once they have been planted.  
 
The loan that he is asking for is to buy manure and foliar applications, since his crops are close to being ready to harvest and he needs to apply the last round of manure to his cornfield.  

His dream is to see his grandson graduate from high school without any problems.  Since he didn't have this opportunity when he was young, he is giving it to his grandson now and he knows that he can achieve it with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy manure and foliar sprays, since his crops are close to harvest and he needs to apply the last round of manure to his cornfield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her crops of corn, beans and coffee

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is  married, with four children and all go to school. She sells used shoes at the market, and has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes.  

She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Grace works six days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She is aspiring of building rental houses. 

Grace resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Art's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Art is 41 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for 21 years. Sometimes, she works for as a paid worker. She can earn about 35,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Art’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and completely paid back the loans, which have helped better support her family’s living to another extent. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to buy pesticides to better support her business. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Dipti

texts.en:
Dipti is a young housewife, age 32 years old, from Maynaguri. She is married to Kamal. Together they are raising one son, who is a student in grade 5. Dipti has a secondary education whereas her husband studied till grade 8. They live in Mouamari, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district, in their own kachha house made of mud, bamboo and wood.

Dipti's husband has been successfully operating a grocery store for a few years. He sells rice, pulses, flour, salt, sugar, biscuits, spices, etc. The shop is adjacent to their house. Dipti also helps him in his shop. It has been a good financial support for their family for so long. Now the demands of the customers are increasing, and he can't fulfill their demands due to lack of money. He needs financial help so he can stock his shop with a variety of products. At the same time, the increased sales will provide them with better revenue.

Dipti asked for a business loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to make bulk purchases of groceries at low cost from wholesalers so that she can make higher sales. She hopes to earn profit, which will help her achieve her targets of better providing for her family, giving proper education to her son, and making her shop bigger with more grocery items.

Dipti thanks her generous lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for their grocery shop.

loans.name: Nelson Agustin

texts.es:
Nelson  tiene 34 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre  vive con su esposa e hijo de 12, 11, 9, 8 y 4 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Nelson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es comprarse un terrero para no arrendar.
Le gusta asistir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 34 years old.  He is in a common law marriage and lives with his wife and children, aged 12, 11, 9, 8 and 4.  He likes to go to church.

He lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of los Ríos.  He belongs to a solidarity group called La Paulina, located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the precinct of La Paulina in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  This solidarity group is dedicated to agriculture and the production of livestock.

For some years, Nelson has made a living farming corn and rice.  He buys his supplies in Ventana and sells his products at a market there. 

He is asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for planting corn.  The loan will help him to increase his income.  His dream is to buy a piece of land so that he doesn't have to rent one.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting corn

loans.name: Houch's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Houch is a 39-year-old mother of four children. For the last 19 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava to make a living. She can earn about 38,000 KHR per day but she can save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is a group loan for Houch’s group of three and she and her group members have been members of VisionFund for three cycles. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family with sufficient food. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Celsa Dinora

texts.es:
Celsa, es una vendedora del cantó,  estudio hasta 7º grado en la escuela luego su madre falleció y ya no existió la posibilidad de seguir estudiando, ya que tenía que trabajar para ayudar a pagar los gastos de la casa.  Actualmente vive solo con su único hijo que está acompañado, pero vive junto a su madre ya que su esposo los abandono cuando su hijo solo tenía 11 años.

Celsa todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar la venta para los niños que van a la escuela,  porque ella tiene cafetín en la escuela de su cantón este centro educativo le queda a una distancia de 400 metros.  Ella vende tostadas de plátano, panes con pollo, sodas, jugos, golosinas entre otras cosas más,  esta actividad la ha estado realizando desde hace 11 años atrás cuando un docente del centro educativo le pidió ayuda a preparar algunos alimentos para los alumnos,  luego ella siguió yendo y empezó con poco y hasta la actualidad ella posee su cafetín dentro de la escuela.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar estantes para poder colocar su producto y otra parte para compra algunos productos, como embutidos, panes, bebidas,  que le hacen falta y que son necesarios en el cafetín.

El sueño de Celsa es poder mejorar su negocio cubrir las deficiencias que hay y que todos sus productos estén bien colocados y ya no poder seguir utilizando cajas de cartón que no son adecuadas para tener productos alimenticios y sabe que lo podrá lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Celsa is a salesperson of the rural community.  She studied until the 7th grade in school.  After her mother died, she was no longer able to continue studying as she had to work to help pay for the house. Currently, she lives alone with her ​​only child. Previously, she lived with her mother as her husband abandoned her when her son was only 11.

Celsa every day gets up very early to prepare for selling to children going to school because she has a cafeteria in the school in her county.  This school is at a distance of 400 meters. She sells toasted banana bread with chicken, sodas, juices, sweets among other things.  She has been working at this activity for 11 years since a teacher at the school asked her to help prepare some food for the students.  Then it kept going and started with little by little and now it has turned in to a school cafe.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy shelves to put her products on and to buy some products, such as sausages, breads, beverages that she needs that are required in the cafeteria.

The dream that Celsa has is to improve her business, fill gaps that exist and ensure that all products are in place and to no longer continue using cardboard boxes that are not appropriate to have food.  She knows you can achieve this with the help of this credit.

loans.use: to buy shelves on which to put her products and buy other products, such as sausages, breads, beverages that she needs and that are required in the cafeteria.

loans.name: Sok Ei's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province, Sok Ei is 24 years old and married. She has one daughter. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for five years. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is a group loan for Sok Ei with VisionFund and she has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already. She completely paid back her loans, which have helped her better support her family’s living. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samba

texts.en:
Samba is married and has one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Samba operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tie dye (Gala) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 69 años de edad, es un agricultor. Su nivel académico es muy bajo ya que solo logro estudiar hasta 4º grado en la escuela de su cantón, actualmente está casado junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa,  juntos formaron un hogar procreando dos hijos los cuales ya no viven junto a ellos y ahora ambos son profesionales. 

Luis es hombre que desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya que cultiva  maíz y frijol esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre quien también se dedico a estos cultivos, anteriormente también se dedicaba a la compra venta de ganado, pero luego por otras razones ya no siguió realizando esta actividad ahora se ha dedicado solamente a la agricultura ya que los terrenos los tiene muy cerca a una distancia de 500 metros.


El dinero de este crédito será invertido para comprar abono, para el cultivo de maíz que ya tiene sembrado una hectárea de terreno  y no tiene fondos y necesita comprar abono ya que la milpa necesita la ultima abonada.


El sueño de Luis es obtener una buena cosecha en esta temporada, ya que sus cultivos muestran que tendrá una buena cosecha y podrá tener una buena ganancia para  pagar su crédito  y con lo demás invertirlo en el cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Luis is 69 years old and is a farmer. His academic level is very low as he only achieved studying until the 4th grade at the school in his district. currently married to his wife who is a housewife, together formed a home procreating two children who are no longer living with them and now both are professionals.

Luis is a man who since childhood has been devoted to agriculture and farming corn and beans.  This trade was taught to him by his father who also was devoted to these crops and previously also engaged in buying and selling cattle.  However fo other reasons he no longer continues to in the cattle business.  Now he is only devoted to agriculture and the land that is very close, a distance of 500 meters.

The money from this loan will be invested in buying fertilizer for growing maize.  He has planted a hectare of land and has no funds and needs to buy fertilizer for the corn from the last harvest.

Luis's dream is to get a good harvest this season, as his crops have shown that a good harvest can have a good profit to pay the loanit and otherwise invest in growing corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing maize and he has planted a hectare of land and has no funds and need to buy fertilizer for the corn needs paid last.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea, 46, is a married mother living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has six children. She is a hard-working farmer who has been growing cassava for 26 years. 

Together with hard work, she earns about 37,000 KHR per day and saves about 20,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Kunthea has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Kunthea wants to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Al- Salheen Group

texts.en:
Al- Salheen is a group that consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old. She lives with her family in a rented house. She studied until her Elementary education, but she couldn't complete her studies. Fatima's husband is employed as a guard in a security company. His salary isn't enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Fatima wants to help her husband with the expenses of the house. She wants to improve their living standards by saving all kinds of food materials inside the house in order to meet all the needs of the family. As a result, Fatima applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house to meet the needs of the family.

Fatima looks forward to opening a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase food for her family

loans.name: Real Atahuallpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REAL ATAHUALLPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia Nelly  tiene  31 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras,  restaurante, agricultura, venta de leña, transporte.
Los socios que salen en la  foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “REAL ATAHUALLPA” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of the same name.

Nelly is 31 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with work at a grocery store business where she sells different kinds of products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things.  She has had this grocery store business for a long time, and it has been successful thanks to the determination that she puts into her work every day.  She wants to continue working and supporting her family.  

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as oil and rice, among other products.  She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to fulfilling the established quotas.  

The other members of the group are in the vegetable, restaurant, farming, firewood, and transport businesses.  The members who appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice and oil, among other things

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a safe location and his primary customers are walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. His business goal is to double his revenue within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Vicenta Del Jesús

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive con ellos. El marido es agricultor.
Doña Vicenta es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante  a base de esfuerzo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como granos, legumbres, plátano y ciertas bebidas, le encanta su negocio ya que allí ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus actividades en  el campo, lleva más de 2 años con su tienda.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres surtir su tienda. Lleva tres ciclos  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos para mejorar su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Estancia Vieja in the Colon parish within the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Estancia Vieja” meet every 15 days. The humble people who live in this place are devoted to agriculture and general trade.

Sra. Vicenta lives in this place. She is 59 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has seven grown children. One daughter lives with her. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Vicenta is a woman who enjoys getting ahead through her efforts. She has a provisions store in her house where she sells all types of basic necessity products such as grains, legumes, bananas, and certain beverages. Vicenta enjoys her business since she able to earn some income to help her move forward since her husband does not earn much from his farming activities. She has managed her store for more than two years.

This loan will be used to buy provisions for her store. Vicenta has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys the help she has received from the loans since they have improved her business and her life. Her dreams include having a larger and well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with five school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated an agricultural  business selling firm produce from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan of 15,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation in her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation in her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as peanuts, salt, and onions

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has operated a retail stall business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more tie dye (Gala) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cereal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Vanny, originally from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, is 33 years old and a mother of four children. Nowadays, three of the children are in school and one is too young for schooling. For her household, rice farming and fishing are the sources of her income to feed the family. They are the businesses that she has involved with for more than 10 years and she can earn 41,700 KHR per day. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of six members to get a loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide for her crop and to buy bamboo to make fish traps to catch more fish. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy pesticide for her crop and bamboo to make fish traps

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah is married with four children that all go to school. She operates a food stall at the market and has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes. She gets additional income from selling black tea in the evening. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She aspires to build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, cassva and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
For the last five years Jesca has been selling french fries and sells to her customers, who are mostly residents, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000. She is married and blessed with three school going children.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to buy more potatoes for making chips and sell to her customers in the community.

Jesca hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be prompt. She operates a household supply shop where she sells household items. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock in order to expand her business. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have success. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her household supply shop.

loans.name: Kelfas

texts.en: Kelfas is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a safe location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather, especially during rainy season which affects transport. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Tosorn's Group

texts.en: Tusorn is 60 years old and a widowed mother of five children, currently four of whom are in school and one is too young for schooling. She lives in Moungkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, where she grows rice and makes cages as the main source of income. She also earns extra income via a paid-working job. This is the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is leading a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and bamboo for her cage business. She hopes to expand her business to a larger scale than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and bamboo tree

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 19-year-old university student majoring in English, and is in his second year. Ahmad lives with his family in Ajloun Jordan. He is seeking to get his Bachelors' degree so that he will find a good job in his study field and start helping his family financially. However, he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as plantains, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Carmen de 53 años de edad es soltera. Ella es parte del grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” y está conformado por 08 socias entusiastas y responsables. Carmen se dedica a la preparación y venta de anticuchos. Ella tiene el anhelo de contar son su propio puesto de venta. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de carne de res y pollo. El grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Carmen es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo blanco con chaleco rojo.
texts.en:
Carmen is 53 years old and single. She is part of the group “Unidos Para Triunfar” (United to Triumph), which consists of eight enthusiastic and responsible members.

Carmen prepares and sells kebobs. She wishes that she had her own vending stall. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beef and chicken.

The group “Unidos Para Triunfar” thanks the Kiva lenders for the support they have offered. In the photo, Carmen is standing second from the right, wearing a white shirt and a red vest.

loans.use: to buy beef and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of potatoes

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling clothing. She buys bridal dresses in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Nasreen is requesting a 60,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a new collection of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old married man from a small village near Nablus, where he lives with his wife and one daughter in a simple house. 

Mahmoud works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which is barely enough to cover all the family's needs, so one year ago he opened a grocery store where he sells different types of grocery products. He has recently taken out a USD loan from FATEN which will help him to buy more products for his store and hence to increase his sales and also his income.
 
Mahmoud appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more products for his store.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is a self-employed woman from the Saramej village of the Lori region. She lives there with her husband and three teenage daughters. Anush also has three sons, two of whom live in the Russian Federation and work there to help their family. As for Anush's younger son, he is 19 years old and serves in the army. 

The family has been engaged in agriculture for 15 years already. They breed cattle and also run a farm where they cultivate wheat, barley, potatoes and cabbages. They also own an orchard. Anush now wants to expand her family's agribusiness a little. 

She has taken out a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to these years of tireless work, she now owns her agribusiness and it is now profitable enough to cover monthly repayments. Anush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no other access to credit products. 

The requested loan will be used to buy 2 oxen.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (2 oxen)

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en:
Mehriban is a housewife and farmer. She is 32 years of age and married with one kid. Mehriban is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her daughter a good life. For that reason, she is working everyday without rest. This activity provides an important source of income for her family because through planting and growing fruit, they have been able to succeed and move forward. Mehriban has run a local grocery store for more than seven years.  In her store, she sells fruits and vegetables .She is the only breadwinner in the family. Her husband and mother help her in organizing her business.

To be able to keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way, Mehriban needs to make some investments. A loan of 1,500 AZN will be a huge help for this hardworking woman and her family, and will enable her to purchase more fruits to resell in her store. The latter will make Mehriban’s store more competitive.

She relies on the goodwill of the lenders and she will be thankful to them for supporting her in sustaining and developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell in her store

loans.name: Ovidio Antonio

texts.es:
Ovidio un orgullo trabajador de 40 años de edad el cual ha tenido que dejar muchos sueños en la vida pro trabajar para su hijo y familia pues como hombre era la única entrada de dinero que tenía su hogar. 
Desea iniciar su negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres buscando ser independiente y su idea es iniciar con una carreta y mercancía recorriendo el sector en busca de ventas que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y en un periodo de tiempo de 3 años lograr posicionarse en un local comercial donde venda mayor y mejor variedad de mercancía. 
Solicita un crédito para iniciar su negocio su ilusión de ser independiente y ofrecer a su núcleo familiar el estilo de  vida que por bajos recursos no ha podido tener
texts.en:
Ovidio, age 40, is a proud worker who has had many dreams in life to work on behalf of his son and his family. As the man, he is the only breadwinner in his household.

Ovidio wants to start a business of selling fruits and legumes so that he can become independent. His idea is to open a small cart with merchandise and travel through the neighborhood in search of sales. This would help to improve his family’s living conditions. Within a period of three years, he plans to position himself at a local shopping center where he can sell a variety of merchandise in bulk and in smaller quantities.

Ovidio is requesting a loan so that he can start his business. His dream is to become independent and provide his family a lifestyle that poor people are not able to have.

loans.use: to buy a cart and a supply of fruits and vegetables so that he can start his business.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy es un hombre trabajador, tiene 40 años de edad y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Tiene 5 hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente sembrando maíz en temporadas favorables, desde hace algún tiempo viene innovando en el cultivo de cacao y le va muy bien ya que desde muy niño apoyaba a sus padres en la chacra y tiene muchos conocimientos sobre ello, a parte que le apasiona cultivar diversos productos y se preocupa por brindar frutos de calidad a los clientes.
Roy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes para poder abonar sus cultivos, también ampliará las plantaciones de cacao para poder obtener mayores ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Gracias a este apoyo seguirá esforzándose para poder más adelante convertirse en el productor más importante de la zona.
texts.en:
Roy is a hardworking man. He is 40 years old and lives with his family in San Martin. Roy has five children who are his greatest source of pride. For this reason, he strives each day to provide them a better future.

Roy has worked in agriculture for many years. He plants mainly corn during favorable seasons. Some time ago, he began dabbling in cacao crops and is doing very well. As a boy, Roy learned how to farm by helping his parents in the fields. He gained a great deal of knowledge from those experiences. In addition, he is passionate about cultivating different crops and is concerned about providing a quality product to his customers.

Roy is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have provided. He will be able to buy supplies so that he can fertilize his crops, which include the cacao plants that he cultivating in order to generate more income. As a result, his family’s quality of life will improve. Thanks to this support, Roy can continue to move forward so that he can become the most important producer in the area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a female Kiva borrower. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 3 to 13 years old. She describes herself as determined. 

Jane operates a dairy and horticulture farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power due to financial instability. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add acreage to her horticulture farm. Her business goal is to be a successful dairy and horticulture farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to add acreage to her horticulture farm

loans.name: Rawand

texts.en: Rawand is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. Since ten years ago, she decided to rely on herself and start her own business at her house selling homemade foods, to help her family to improve their lifestyle. Rawand is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to better her business merchandise in order to be able to give a very good quality of products. She is very happy and optimistic about her future and wishes to sell all her products.

loans.use: to better her homemade food business merchandise.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself as self-driven. 

He operates a barber shop where he provides barber services. He has been involved in this business for 5 years, and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of good equipment, so he will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase some good equipment.  

This is Geoffrey's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He hopes that in the future he will be successful and financially  stable.

loans.use: to purchase good equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Hemmings

texts.en:
Hemmings is a married man who describes himself as optimistic. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle, and he has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have a well-developed and quality business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
The Arise and Shine group is made up of seven people who live in the same district in Ghana. This is the seventh time that the group is requesting financial help from ID-Ghana in order to be able to increase the level of their business. They are into provisions, ice chests, flasks, blenders, second hand clothing, cutlery sets, combs, slippers and turkey tail.

The group's representative, Joana, is 32 and married with three children. Her children go to school. She has been selling ice chests, flasks and blenders for three years. Joana gets her supplies from the distributors at wholesale prices and sells door-to-door in Teshie and the environs. In order to be able to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and income, Joana is requesting her seventh loan from ID-Ghana, together with the other Arise and Shine group members. This loan will enable them to increase their product inventories and to satisfy their clients.

loans.use: To buy ice chests, flasks and blenders to sell

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 28-year-old, Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and two children. Her husband provides the main income of the family.

She has worked as a private teacher since 2013. She took up this profession as she feels that she is helping students to get the necessary education. She has prepared a special room in her house where she receives her students. 

Now Roula is requesting to take out a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy a new laptop to help her in her work.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her work as a private teacher

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 47-year-old married mother of three who has been working with her husband in running their bakery since 2001 to develop it and reply to the increasing customers needs.

Julie is a hard worker. Her bakery is well known in her region and is highly recommended. Her acquired income is enough to cover her family's needs, but unfortunately can't cover her extra needs. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's educational tuition fees.

She hopes to expand her business in the future, in order to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To pay for her children's educational tuition fees

loans.name: Ayham

texts.en: Ayham is an 18-year-old high school student who lives with his family in Ajloun, Jordan. He is seeking to find a good job after he finishes his studies so that he will start helping his family financially. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Naema

texts.en: Naema is a conservative lady. So she asked her son Tariq to appear in the photo instead. She lives in Salt, Jordan with her family consisting of four members. Her son Tariq is a university student majoring in Business Administration and he is in his third year. He is seeking to find a job in his study field after he gets his Bachelor's degree so that he can support his family financially. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, Naema has applied for this loan to support him.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a married man. He has two children who are five years old and eight years old. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he cooks and sells mandazi (East African donuts). He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a safe area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of ingredients. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour for making mandazi. His business goal is to double his revenue within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour for making mandazi

loans.name: Ahmadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ahmadou est maçon depuis plus de 10 ans, il est marié et père de famille. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et voulant diversifier son activité, sollicite un prêt pour acquérir une moto et faire du transport qui marche bien vers cette zone. Avec ses heures libres, car ce n’est pas tout le temps qu’il a des chantiers, il conduira  lui-même la moto l’après-midi. 
Ahmadou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et de ses parents car il vit en famille.
Il a un projet dans l’avenir, d’acquérir un véhicule aussi pour en faire un taxi.
texts.en:
Monsieur Ahmadou has been a bricklayer for over 10 years. He is married and a father. 

This is his first UIMCEC loan. He is asking for a loan to diversify his business. He will buy a motorcycle that he can use for transportation services. These services do well in his area. When he's free (he isn't working on construction sites all the time), he will ride his motorcycle in the afternoon.

Ahmadou takes care of his daily household expenses and those of his parents (as he lives with them). In the future, he'd like to buy a vehicle that he can use as a taxi.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for transportation services.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mariam dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 15,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice and soaps for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice and soap to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest and focused. She operates a grocery shop where she a variety of groceries. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional inventory and expand her business. Her business goal is to grow into a large grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to generate wealth. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en: Baraa is a 30-year-old married lady who lives in Ajloun, Jordan with her family consisting of six members. Her husband serves in the military and his income isn't enough to cover his children's needs. For that reason, she started her own business selling food products at her own mini-market to be a second provider for the family for the last year. Now she is seeking a youth loan to merchandise her mini market with more food products so that she can increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her mini market

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar  is a 37 -year-old single man. He lives with his parents and earns money to cover family’s demands. He has been working in a water team project for 10 years and has good experience in this area. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

Elmar knows everything about water channels. He knows how to prepare projects for different regions, how to build them and how to keep them in control. Additionally, he takes part in building the channels. The team build new irrigation canals for all neighboring regions in order to improve living conditions and  crop  productivity.

Elmar’s income doesn’t cover family’s living expenses. He applied for 1,000 AZN to buy new quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team members. This will increase the quality of his team’s work and income.

loans.use: to buy new quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team members.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, wheat flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and she has all types of customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use 35,000 KES to buy wheat flour, washing soap, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP micro finance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, washing soap, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother of two and lives in Voi. She sells groceries with the help of her family. Agnes is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She struggles to improve her grocery stall, sell more, and save money to have a more formal establishment. Agnes requests 20,000 KES to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to make detergents to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 49-year-old married mother of three who has had a home-based business since 2000.  She  sells homemade food.  This business helps  to improve her family's lifestyle and meet their daily needs. 

Mariam requests a loan from Kiva partner Vitas S.A.L.  to improve her business merchandise and provide the best products to her clients. She has a good reputation in her hometown. She is certain that she will sell all products and expand her business. She hopes in the near future to  open her own store.

loans.use: to improve her  merchandise.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for sale. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of fruits and vegetables to enable him to open a grocery business for his wife. His business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits and vegetables to enable him to open a grocery business for his wife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his shop

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a 41-year-old mother of four, who opened a grocery store two years ago. The store helps to support the family's income to cover their necessary living needs.

Claudine's store is small but her diversified products satisfy her customers' needs. She always updates her business products, but needs another source of products to increase her merchandise with special offer products that will attract new customers.

She has to search for other dealers with special products that best meet her business plan and wants to invest her additional income to cover her family's needs.  She is working towards a stable business. She will use a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car to support  her family and business development needs. 

She wishes that one day she can expand her small grocery store into a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy a car  for her family's and business development needs.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en: Elisha is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a transport business where he offers transport services. He describes his family challenge to be the lack of sufficient water for family consumption and the lack of enough resources to buy water daily. He will use the KES 75,000 loan to buy a 10,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will own several rental houses. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 10,000 liter water tank

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used the previous loan to buy Irish potatoes and sorghum to sell. He has continued with farming, especially dairy and banana production. He is facing challenges of weather changes especially drought when animals need more grass and water leading to low milk production. However, he hopes of expanding his farm.

David needs a loan to buy a heifer.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mobile phones and mobile credit cards to sell

loans.name: Flor De Retama De Rumira Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FLOR DE RETAMA DE RUMIRA,el banco está ubicado en  el distrito de Ollantaytambo,provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jacinta tiene 50 años de edad es separada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos para su clientes que le solicitan como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores, tienda de abarrotes, transporte.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member is a woman who belongs to the communal bank FLOR DE RETAMA DE RUMIRA. The bank is in the district of Ollantaytambo, province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member Jacinta is 50 years old, is separated and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with the restaurant business. Jacinta has had her business for a long while and it is doing well thanks to the commitment she puts into her business every day. She makes different types of dishes for customers who request them, such as rice with chicken, sautéed meat, soups and more. She wants to continue working in this way to continue to support her family.

The member is asking for the loan to buy supplies such as oil and rice. She is grateful for the loan granted and promises to meet the quotas laid down.

The other members are engaged in agriculture, small livestock farming, a grocery store and transport.

The member whose photo is attached separately asked for permission to be late for the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil and rice

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es:
Julio tiene 26 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con sus padres, esposa e hijoS de 1 año Y 7 meses. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cría vacas desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, arroz,y balanceado para los animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es seguir en la agricultura y ayudarle en los estudios a su hija.
Le gusta hacer deporte, y arreglar motos.
texts.en:
Julio, age 26, is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his parents, partner, and children, ages 1-year-old and seven months. He lives in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. 

His communal bank is called La Paulina. It is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the community of La Paulina; it belongs to the Pueblo Viejo region. This communal bank deals with farm and cattle work. 

Julio works in farming, having sown corn and rice, and raised cattle for some time. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same community. 

He asked for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and compost for his corn and rice fields, and balanced feed for his livestock. The loan has helped him to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life. His dream is to continue in agriculture and help with his daughter's education. He likes to play sports and repair motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
Universal is a group of four persons whose members live in the same neighborhood. They are into provisions, maize, cassava dough, fish and materials. The representative for the group, Cathrine, is 33 years old and is married to Phillip. The couple has four children, all attending school and of whom all are under their care.

Cathrine lives with her children and her husband, and the couple manages together the various household expenditures.

Over the past six years Cathrine has been selling maize and cassava dough as a side business from her home. She gets her supplies from one of Ghana's markets.

This is the third time that Cathrine and the other members of the Universal Group have requested financial support from ID Ghana to strengthen their working capital and their businesses, and better meet their customers' needs. The first two loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy more maize and cassava to sell to customers.

loans.name: Roxana Alcira

texts.es: Roxana de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, el esposo trabaja en la agricultura y ayuda en el negocio, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y buenos precios, con lo que tiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo, Roxana solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el negocio y comprar sopas, café, granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y seguir con sus ventas para tener más ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana, 32, lives with her husband and their three children.  Her husband works in agriculture and helps out with the store she has set up in her home.  She has many customers because of the wide variety of products and good prices she offers.  

Roxana is requesting a loan to buy soups, coffee, basic grains, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks, etc.   This is so she can continue with her sales and earn more income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy soups, coffee, basic grains, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Copacabana - Belempata Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN COPACABANA - BELEMPATA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ocobamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Encarnación tiene 49 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia distribuye su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas como naranjas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura.
La persona que sale con la cara tapara no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN COPACABANA - BELEMPATA, which is located int he district of Ocobamba in the province of La Convención, department of Cusco.

Encarnación, 49, has three children and a common-law husband.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling fruit.  She has worked in the business for several years; and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day.  The member distributes the merchandise to the customers who place orders.  Her aim is to continue working this way to support her family.

Encarnación is requesting a loan to buy fruit such as oranges, etc.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

The other members of the group are involved in agriculture.  The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as oranges, etc.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food she sells. Her business goal is to own a modern hotel within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food she sells

loans.name: Gerardo Leonel

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltero vive con sus padres, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Gerardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventana y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a mejorar en los negocios. Su sueño es comprar un carro y un terreno.
Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

The communal bank is named LA PAULINA. It is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the community of La Paulina. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. The bank is dedicated to agricultural and livestock work. 

Gerardo works as a farmer, having grown corn and rice for some years. He buys his materials in Ventanas and sells his products in the market there. He asked for the loan to buy fertilizer to plant corn and rice. The loan has helped him to improve his businesses. His dream is to buy a car. He likes to play football.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and two children. 

Since 2013, she has worked as a private teacher. She loves her profession so much and she loves to be independent. She prepared a special room in her house where she receives her students. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop to help in her work. She wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 56-year-old married woman who has five children. She describes herself as optimistic. Hellen operates a retail business where she sells a variety of cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Hellen describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase additional stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own a posho mill within five years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cereals.

loans.name: Walter Alexander

texts.es:
Walter de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos que estudian 3º y 7ºgrado el menor aun no estudia.

Walter se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a la siembra de granos básicos especialmente al frijol y maíz, además  siembra yuca; aprendió a sembrar ya que toda su familia se ha dedicado  a la agricultura, el terreno donde siembra está a 10 minutos de su hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para la compra de insumos agrícolas, abono, fertilizantes, veneno; ya que sembrara 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol y 7,000 de maíz.

Espera seguir trabajando en el campo para mantener a su familia para que no le falten los servicios básicos del hogar, y darles el estudio a sus hijos; porque desea verlos graduarse de alguna carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Walter, 35, has a 7th grade education.  He and his common-law wife, who is a homemaker, have three children.  The eldest two are in 3rd and 7th grade and the youngest does not attend school yet.

Walter spends most of his time growing basic grains such as beans and corn.  He also grows yucca.  He learned agriculture from his family who are farmers.  His land is about ten minutes from his house.

The loan he is requesting is to buy farm supplies: compost, fertilizers and weed-killer, and to plant 14,000 square meters of beans and 7,000 of corn.

He hopes to continue working in the field to support his family so the household will always have basic utilities.  He wants to give his children an education and see them get a university degree.

loans.use: To buy compost, fertilizers, weed-killer and to plant 14,000 square meters of beans and 7,000 of corn.

loans.name: Elsy Yolanda

texts.es:
Elsy de 52 años de edad, dejo de estudiar cuando iba a tercer año de la universidad y no pudo seguir debido al embarazo que tuvo, actualmente está soltera con tres hijos, nadie vive con ellos ya que ya formaron su familia, ella vive con un pastor de la religión evangélica.

La señora desde hace 6 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado y aprendió por iniciativa propia, la señora sale a vender sus productos a la ciudad y se traslada en bus; el horario de su trabajo es prácticamente en horas de la mañana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar zapatos especialmente sandalias,  cadenas, ropa para niño y niña y ropa interior.

En un futuro desea tener un local en el centro de la ciudad, para no estarse movilizando a diario, espera vender toda la mercadería para seguirle invirtiendo con las ganancias que le quedan, además espera pagar todas las deudas que ha contraído sin ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Elsy, 52, quit her education when she was about to begin her third year at university.  She was unable to continue because she was expecting a child.  She is currently single and lives with her three children and an evangelical pastor.

For six years Elsy has been selling clothing and shoes which she learned about on her own initiative.  She works as a street vendor in the city where she goes by bus.  Most of her work is done during the morning hours.

The loan she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy shoes (especially sandals), bracelets, children's clothing and underwear.

In the future she wants to open a shop in the city center so she does not have to move around so much.  She hopes to sell all of her merchandise so she can continue investing the profit in her business.  She also wants to pay off debt easily.

loans.use: To buy shoes (especially sandals), bracelets, children's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as caring. 

He operates a hardware shop where he sells hardware products and spare auto parts. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are urban residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insecurity. 

He will use the Kes 28,000 loan to buy more stock of spare auto parts and hardware items for resale. His business goal is to open additional outlets within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of spare auto parts and hardware items

loans.name: Badi Mala Shg Group

texts.en:
Devki and the other three members are part of Badi Mala Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO MESP. 

Devki, 49, is the featured borrower of this group. She lives in Hatnanga village, Dumka district, Jharkhand. She is married and has a son. Her sister-in-law also stays with them. The family makes and sells garlands. It is their main source of income.  A few years back, Devki and her family was into agriculture for their income but due to insufficient rains and losses, they switched over to the garland business. 

Devki and her son started selling ready-made garlands. They used to buy them from other manufacturers and sell them, but this wasn’t getting them a good profit. So she gradually learned how to make garlands and started making them on her own. Now they earn around INR 400-500 per day. 

Devki is requesting a loan to expand her business, as there is a growing demand for garlands in her locality. She will use the loan to buy flowers and other materials to make garlands in bulk. 

She dreams of running the business on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy flowers and other materials to make garlands
